They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses by adding more goods to their businesses. This will enable them to make better profit so that they can better meet their children’s academic, nutritional and medical needs. 

Abie N. (left) is the leader of this group. Abie was born in Gbemdembu village about fifteen miles from Makeni city. She is married to a road constructor and they have three children. Abie and her husband have to work hard to pay school fees and other school-related charges for their three children who are still attending school. Abie has been selling fire-wood and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) for the past seventeen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene sells drinks and other items. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more drinks and turkey to sell.  She says thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more turkey and drinks

loans.name: B & B Group

texts.en:
This is Jatu K. and Adama T.. They named their group B & B. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city who wants a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make more sales, earn more profit and improve their living standard.

Jatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. Jatu was born in Makeni thirty years ago. She is married to a motor-bike repairman and they have five children. Jatu and her husband have to work very hard to look after their children who are still attending school. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), the other is in JSS II, the others are in class V and class II. Their last one is still not of school-going age. Jatu sells market food and fire-wood. She has been a businesswoman for more than fifteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Саломат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ёкубова Саломат 1960 года рождения, замужем имеет четверых детей. Саломат занимается торговлей продуктами питание. Она закупает товар на оптовых рынках города Худжанда и возит продавать в районы области. В этом ей помогает муж. Торговля идет успешно так как сейчас сезон свадеб. Поэтому она хочет, разнообразить свой ассортимент. На запрашиваемый займ Саломат закупит печенье и разных видов конфет.

loans.use: на закупку печенье, разных видов конфет

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 32-year-old woman married to Misael, a driver, and they have two small children (aged 3 and 4). They make their home in Pandan, a beautiful coastal town in the north of Antique province.

When Jenny started her business two years ago with ASHI (the field partner), it was to buy a tricycle for her husband to drive so they could make money. A tricycle is the most common form of transportation here, especially for the poor. It's a motorbike with a side car that people ride short distances in to get from A to B.

Jenny has paid off all of her previous loans and is now seeking a loan to buy parts for the tricycle to make it run smoother, such as brake pads, engine sprockets, new tires, bearings, and a new chain.

Everything she does, she does for her children. She dreams one day of having more than one tricycle and a shop where her and her husband can store them overnight and make repairs. Ultimately, she would like to send her children to college.

Jenny thanks you for your consideration in supporting her loan.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Repairing and upgrading her tricycle

loans.name: Shelaw Group

texts.en:
Shelaw wants to take out a loan for her beauty salon. Ahmeda wants to take out a loan for her husband who does animal husbandry. Malali wants to take out a loan for a tailoring business, and Torpayki wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business.

Shelaw is the leader of the Shelaw group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for the progress of their business: to make it larger. They have requested a group loan 40,000 afghani. They are saying that Kiva is the best loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For a beauty salon

loans.name: Ametowoyona

texts.fr: Ametowoyona A. est un jeune homme de 31 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. mécanicien 2 roues à Adeta. Avec ce crédit il souhaite acheter des outils de travail et aussi des motos usées pour les réparer et les revendre. Cette chance lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ametowoyona A. is a young man, 31 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is a bike mechanic in Adeta. With this loan, he wishes to buy work tools and also used motorbikes to repair and resell. This chance will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Wan Word group. They include Mariatu D., Isatu Daramay, Fatmata K. and Aminata K.. They are small -scale businesswomen in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They are applying for a loan of Le 500,000 each to help them expand their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to buy more goods to add to their various businesses, make more sales and more profit, and consequently improve their living standards.

The leader of this group is Mariatu K. (left). Mariatu was born in Sanda village, northeast of Makeni city. She is now thirty-eight years of age. She is married to a driver and they have three children. One of her children is in Senior Secondary School II, the others in class five and class four. Mariatu sells slippers; she has been a businesswoman since childhood.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in the business for a long time. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Omo

texts.en: Omo operates a phone booth business making calls for people in her community. She is 26 years old and single. She has been in the business for a long time. She is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase additional rechargeable phone cards to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Урунджон

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Урунджон 1956 года рождения, замужем мать троих детей. Муж работает садовником. Урунджон 10 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания. Раньше она закупала из кондитерских цехов пряники и сдавала оптом на рынке Панчшанбе продавцом.Сейчас она стала сама ездить в районы области торговать продуктами питания. Она 3 года кредитуется в нашей организации. В период кредитования увеличила товарооборот и ассортимент товара. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить макароны и сахар.

loans.use: на закупку макаронов и сахара

loans.name: Hakamadah's Group

texts.en: K. Hakamadah is the leader of this group in Buloba. He is 45 years old and has had a fishing business for over seven years. He is a father of six children, four of which are still in school and he cares for two grand children. Although he fishes himself, he owns two boats with two employees that pay him every day. He is a very hard working man.  He also has two cows and hopes to increase the number of his cows and boats from efficient use of his loans. Hakamadah is asking for a loan to help buy more fishing nets and hooks for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Idugboe

texts.en: I. is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells food.  She is asking for a loan of NGN 40,000 in order to purchase more food to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa I. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est forgeron à Adeta. Il souhaite avec ce troisième crédit acheter des outils de travail notamment des bar de fer afin de pouvoir exécuter ses œuvres. Il compte sur cette chance pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Issa Issifo, age 33, is married and the father of one child. He is a blacksmith in Adeta. He wishes to use this third loan to buy work tools and materials, especially iron bars, in order to carry out his work. He is counting on this chance to change his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a 66-year-old woman married to Vincento, a laborer, and they have two grown children. She has had her Sari Sari store (general store) for over 12 years and has taken out nine loans, paying each of them back 100% and on time. Each one has helped her just a little bit more with extra capital to rise up from poverty and make a better life for her and her family.

This loan for 28,000 Pesos will be used to purchase goods and groceries for her store, but she is really excited because she plans to buy the cement-making materials to be able to make hallowblocks for beneath her store, which essentially support the framework and make the foundation stronger. 

Her biggest goals are to continue to help her children in any way she can (especially with costs associated with education) and to improve her whole family's way of living.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To rebuild her general store and buy items for the store

loans.name: Хуршеда

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Домуллоева Хуршеда 24 года, замужем имеет одного ребенка. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Хуршеда торгует в районах области продуктами питания. Её торговая точка расположена в центре базара и поэтому торговля у неё идет хорошо. Товар она закупает у оптовиков. Она хотела бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. На запрашиваемый займ она закупит гречку и муку. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: на закупку гречки и муки

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina sells drinks and snacks. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan amount of 3,000 NGN to purchase juice and other drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and snacks

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 66 years old and married with 15 children. His wife sells medicines. He has been in business for a long time. He hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам 1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на водоносной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом .После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке. Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 лет. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на закупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. is a 42-year-old store owner who has been in business for 15 years. Her husband works overseas and she lives with their seven children. They live in one of the poor communities of Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Elena used to earn money by cooking and serving food to her neighbors until she opened a small variety store three months ago. She makes a daily income of P 600 and has hired two youngsters to assist her in her business.

She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for four years. She is now seeking a loan of P 12,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store, reducing the frequency of trips to the market to buy more inventory.

Elena is working hand-in-hand with her husband, who works miles away, to sustain her children’s education. She also dreams of owning a bigger grocery store.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for sale in her store

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca is 30 years old and is a widow with three children. She sells drinks and snacks.

At present, Franca wants to expand her business so she is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks, juice and snacks for people to buy. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and snacks to sell

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Adolat has operated a business of selling fabrics that are specifically intended for sewing national dresses. She sells her wares in the famous market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand, Tajikistan. A hard-working mother of three, Adolat has successfully grown her business, inspired by her goal to establish a stable income for her family.

Currently, Adolat is seeking a loan of $2,700 USD to enlarge her variety of goods for sale. With the increased profits, she hopes to continue supporting her children's education. She hopes that someday her children will become educated professionals in their sphere of knowledge.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and married to Felix, who is a laborer, and they have four children ranging in age from 17 to 23.

Elisa has had her variety store for three years and has had a total of nine loans from ASHI, all of which helped her with her business and helped her to raise her family up from poverty. She paid them all back 100% and on time.

With 17,000 Pesos of this 35,000 Pesos loan, Elisa will be able to purchase groceries for her variety store. The remainder, she is planning to use for a welding machine for her husband's work and, with the little bit left, a fishing net so that they might start a fishing business too. It's very wise here to have more than one income, since weather and other factors affect businesses and Elisa has been working hard for years to be able to start to diversify her business.

Elisa’s dream is that, someday, her small store will become a bigger store but, more than anything, she wants good health for her family and education for their futures so they might not have to live in poverty.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy goods for her variety store and a welding machine for her husband

loans.name: Amatou

texts.fr: Amatou A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de divers articles à Adeta depuis 2 ans. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son entreprise en payant des produits de beauté et des bijoux pour revendre.
texts.en:
Amatou A., age 39, is married and the mother of two. She has been a retailer of various goods for two years in Adeta. She would like to use this loan to improve the capacity of her enterprise by buying beauty products and jewelry to sell.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Рустам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
.

Рахматов Рустам , один из известных шашлычников в Худжанде. Он изготавливает очень вкусные и качественные шашлыки из мясо акарачка и мясо баранины. Его точка реализации расположена в центре города, поэтому у него стабильная торговля и много своих клиентов. На следующий кредит он хочет увеличить производство шашлыка, а следовательно прибыль, которую хочет использовать на ремонт дома.

loans.use: продажа шашлыка

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is from Edo State, Nigeria. He is 31 years old and unmarried. He sells pharmaceutical medicines and rechargeable phone cards in his small store and also makes calls.

He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to offer for sale.

He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is married and is the father of two small children. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Zafar started his own small venture after his relatives suggested he should try his luck as a market vendor. Today Zafar runs a small business selling junior clothing, primarily selling to teens and young people. His vending facility has a very favorable location and offers a large assortment of merchandise, and this attracts many customers.

Zafar believes that financial support from IMON International has helped him boost his sales and grow his business. He would like a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase inventory wholesale. Zafar believes this loan will help him further develop his business and get additional income to improve his family’s living standards.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase working capital to develop the business.

loans.name: Zakiu Group

texts.en: Zakiu is the group leader of Zakiu Group. There are three members in this group and they all want a loan to progress their businesses so they are requesting a group of loan 22500 Afghani. Zakiu will use the loan for her tailoring business. Aziza wants to use the loan for her business of bead working, and Nazifa wants the loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable cart. They are very happy about this lending process being in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: To progress their businesses.

loans.name: Бисокина

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бисокина проживает и торгует на рынке Костакоза.Её ассортимент составляют хозяйственные товары для дома.Она имеет двоих детей, которые помогают ей на базаре, при отсутствии матери.для закупа с оптового рынка Истаравшана  Бисокина хочет получить кредит в "Арванде".На снимке Бисокина в день выдачи.

loans.use: на расширение продажи хозтоваров

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
M. Mavlyuda is married and has three children. Her husband is a truck driver, but he does not earn enough to support the family alone. Mavlyuda began selling traditional national women's trousers nine years ago.

She needs a loan of 8,130 Somoni to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a varied product line. If you could help Mavlyuda grow her business, she and her family would sincerely appreciate it.

It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase her range of clothing goods for sale

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar has developed a successful clothing business, selling higher-quality women’s underclothes and children’s clothes. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having started her venture about eight years ago. Dilbar chose to sell women’s underclothes because she knew there would always be good demand from women desiring to replenish their wardrobe.

She tries to maximize her sales by frequently updating her product selection, and she has requested a loan to help her purchase new supplies of clothing inventory. Dilbar has proven to be a hard-working entrepreneur with integrity and we are happy to further assist with her business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy new children's clothing in order to expand her range of clothes for sale

loans.name: Dilshot

texts.en: S. Dilshot is 40 years old and is married with three children. For more than seven years, Dilshot has been running her own business. She has a place in the local market where she sells trousers for women and girls. Considering that the national trousers are a very important item for most women and girls of her country, Dilshot’s business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerable income to the family budget. Now, Dilshot is planning to purchase trousers of the modern style in order to increase the range of goods she sells. With this purpose in mind, she requests the loan of 8,300 Somoni. Having a positive credit history, Dilshot promises to repay the loan promptly. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and the strength to better her family’s life. loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на водоносной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом . После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке.Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 лет. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Maria De Lurdes

texts.pt:
Maria de Lurdes M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, mulher de 39 anos de idade e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 23 anos e todos frenquentam escola. Maria parou de estudar na 9 classe devido à gravidez precoce.

Vive com o seu marido e os seus cinco filhos, somente, na casa própria.
Cresceu junto dos seus pais, tendo perdido a sua mãe no ano de 1980 quando criança. Estudava e fazendo pequenos negócios durante 5 anos e casou se no ano de 1990. Inicia o negocio de venda de frangos e ovos nove anos mais tarde e actualmente vende produtos de mercenária. É dona do negocio desde o remoto ano de 1990 e aprendeu, sem empregado. Vende basicamente sumos, leite, milo e café como produtos de referencia. Adquire-os na áfrica do sul (por exemplo, 1 caixa de leite compra a 110,00MT e vende a 420,00MT). Tem uma receita mensal no valor de 10.000,00MT.
Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos que operam na praça.

Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e tendo submetido o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 16.000,00MT que aplicou na aquisição de mercadoria.
Com o credito de 20.000,00MT pretende reforçar o seu negocio.
Tem como plano futuro expandir o negocio para outras zonas e comprar o segundo carro para facilitar a movimentação.
texts.en:
Maria de Lurdes M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children with ages between 8 and 23 years old. All of them are in school. Maria stopped her schooling in the 9th grade due to an early pregnancy. She lives with her husband and 5 children in their own home. She grew up with her parents, but she lost her mother in 1980 when she was still a child. She went to school and did small businesses for 5 years and married in 1990. She began her business of selling chickens and eggs 9 years later, and currently she sells home goods. She has been the owner of the business since 1990 and learned without any employees. As a reference, she basically sells juices, milk, corn, and coffee. She acquires them in South Africa (for example, 1 box of milk costs 110MT and sells for 420MT). She has monthly receipts of 10,000MT. She has never had any loans with other banks that operate in the district. She heard of Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and took the first loan in the amount of 16,000MT for the purchase of merchandise. With credit of 20,000MT she intends to strengthen her business. She has future plans to expand the business to other zones and purchase a second car to facilitate the transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of grocery products

loans.name: Elisa Eugenio

texts.pt:
Elisa Eugenio C. C. natural da provincia de Gaza (a 240 km de Maputo) mulher de 43 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos (2 trabalham e a menina esta no lar). 
Parou de estudar na 5 classe quando começou a namorar.

Agora é casada oficial e vive com seu marido na casa própria, sem ninguém mais para sustentar.
Cresceu junto dos seus progenitores e saiu de Gaza juntamente com os seus pais quando tinha quatro anos de idade e no ano de 1979 casou se com o seu marido com quem vive ate data então.
Iniciou a actividades comercial há dez anos vendendo produtos diversos num mini estabelecimento que abre as 8horas e 22 horas, trabalha sem empregado.

Aprendeu a fazer negócios com a sua mãe a mais de 15 anos. O seu produto de mais destaque é ovo que os adquire a 190,00MT e vende 255,00MT cada caixa. consegue um rendimento mensal de 1.200,00MT
Ouve falar se da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas residentes da zona. Nunca pediu empréstimo em outros bancos e este é o seu primeiro com a esta instituição, no valor de 15.000,00MT, que pretende aumentar o volume de negocio e ganhar mais receita.

Elisa propõe se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos e atingir objectivos futuro, expandir a actividade e construir uma loja grande.
texts.en:
Elisa Eugenio C. C. is a native of the province of Gaza (240km from Maputo). She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children (2 work and the little girl is at home). She stopped her schooling in the 5th grade when she began dating. Now she is officially married and lives with her husband in their own home without anyone else to support. She grew up with her parents and grandparents and left Gaza with her parents when she was 4 years old. In 1979 she married her husband with whom she lives today. She began her commercial activities 10 years ago selling various products in a small establishment that opens from 8:00am to 10:00pm. She works without any employees. She learned the business from her mother more than 15 years ago. Her best products are eggs which she acquires for 190MT and sells for 255MT per box. She earns 1,200MT monthly. She came to know about Hluvuku-Adsema through a friend in the neighborhood. She has never requested a loan from another bank, and this is her first loan with this institution. This loan is 15,000MT and she intends to use it to increase the volume of her business and earn more sales. Elisa is committed to repaying the loan without problems so she can request additional loans to attain her future objectives. She wants to expand her activities and construct a large store.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grocery products

loans.name: Niètaga (Le Succès) Group

texts.fr:
Niètaga est un regroupement de cinq femmes du  premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui sont  des voisines de longue date. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles polygames. 
Elles mènent  différentes activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente de produits cosmétiques,  des boissons et des habits. Elles font  aussi de  la restauration. Les articles de ces femmes du groupe Niètaga sont très sollicités dans la ville de Koutiala et elles ont de l’expérience dans leur secteur d’activité.
Dans l’objectif d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de sucre, une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires et du riz pour la restauration, au marché de Koutiala et quant aux habits et aux  produits cosmétiques elles  les achètent  à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles vendent leurs marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000 FCFA chacune au cour de  ce cycle. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer à la prise en charge des dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Dans l’avenir, le Groupe Niètaga compte obtenir chacun un prêt plus  élevé pour élargir leur activité.
texts.en:
Niètaga is a group of 5 women of the first neighborhood of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region), who've been neighbors for a long time. They average 35 years of age, and are the mother of at least 5 children. They are married and most of them live in polygamous families. They run various businesses, such as : selling cosmetics, drinks, and clothing, as well as food serving. These women are experienced in their field, and their products are in high demand in Koutiala.

In view of expanding their businesses, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are now seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan), and all previous loans were repaid without problems.

This loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, sacks of sugar, a large amount of food condiments, and rice for the food-serving businesses. It will also be used to buy clothing and cosmetics in Bamako (the capital of Mali). They retail their products at the grand market in Koutiala, for cash and on credit, to a diverse clientele.

With this new loan, the women count on turning an average profit of XOF 140'000 (ca US$ 310) each, to be used to repay the loan and help with the daily expenses of their families. In the future, the members of the Niègata group hope to obtain a higher loan, to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, food condiments, rice, clothing, and cosmetics

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph E. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est tailleur à Adeta. Il exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et il est doué dans son métier. Joseph désire avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et des tissus pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some cloth

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Angelina M. nasce na cidade de maputo, mulher de 40 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos todos encontrando se estudar nas escolas oficiais. estudou ate 9 classe e parou por razoes sociais e financeiras .

Vive na casa própria com seu marido e os três filhos menores de idade. Teve toda a sua infância na província do maputo (no bairro de malhazine) e nunca saiu.
Tem experiência na actividade comercial que exerce a mais de 5 anos, aprendeu fazendo numa escola vendendo lanche para as crianças.

O seu rendimento mensal é de 10.000,00MT e consegue poupar 5.000,00MT, mensalmente.
Esta é a primeira vez que faz empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema gracas a informações obtidas através de amigas. Com o credito de 15.000,00MT pretende ampliar o seu negocio e satisfazer a demanda.
Tem como desafio fazer algumas roupas e vender para lançar o seu talento e num pequeno estabelecimento feito de material convencional.

Compromete se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros novos.
texts.en:
Angelina M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 40 years old and has four children who study in public schools. She attended school through ninth grade, when she had to drop out for social and financial reasons. She lives in her own home with her husband and three youngest children. She spent her whole childhood in Maputo (in the Malhazine neighborhood) and never left. She has experience in retail, which has been her business for more than five years. She started by selling snacks to children in a school. Her monthly income is 10,000 meticals, of which she is able to save 5000 meticals each month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, which she found out about through friends. With her 15,000-metical loan she intends to expand her business and satisfy increasing demand. One of her challenges will be to make some clothing for sale, launching her talent in a small shop. She is committed to paying off her loan without problems so that she can request new ones.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling products

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr: Aboubakar A. est un jeune homme de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est tailleur à Adeta. Aboubakar exerce c métier depuis 4 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre et aussi tenir le commerce des tissus afin d’assister les clients dans le choix de tissus à confectionner.
texts.en:
Aboubakar A. is a young man, 28 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a tailor in Adeta. He has been working at this trade for four years. He wishes to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and also to do business in fabrics in order to assist customers with a choice of fabrics for making clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Elizabeth hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Esabella is a mother of seven children. She operates an outdoor catering business. She prepares food for school children as a result of a government initiative of creating a feeding programme for children in primary schools. She also caters events like weddings on a need basis. This business has enabled her to educate all her children and currently she is educating 3 more children who are orphans. Her business has also created employment opportunities for eight staff. With an aspiration of ensuring self-sufficiency through creating more employment opportunities, she is borrowing Ksh. 50,000 to expand her business. This money will enable her to buy a cooker and an oven. With these facilities she can start to bake cakes and employ more staff.

loans.use: To buy a cooker and an oven for baking cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.pt:
Roberto Carlos M., de 40 anos de idade, casado e pai 5 filhos de mães diferentes. Estudou a te 8 classe tendo parado forçosamente. todos filhos estudam e tem idades compreendidas entre 5 e 13 anos.

Roberto nasce em maputo e cresce junto dos seus pais ate a altura que saiu o seu nome para ir cumprir serviço militar obrigatório numa altura em que a guerra civil estava bastante intensa nos pais. Foge para áfrica do sul, por temer ser soldado, na companhia de amigos, onde trabalhou durante muitos anos. Regressa no ano 1990 e junta se com a sua primeira esposa e ambos nasceram 4 filhos e tendo se divorciada desta por motivos sociais.vive na casa própria apenas com a sua família.
Roberto casa se com a actual esposa com a qual ainda tem um filho, o tal de 5 anos. 
Enquanto ia a escola costumava passar duma carpintaria para apreciar as obras feitas e aprender, de forma voluntária, a fazer alguns artigos/objectos. Ganhou vocação e paixão pela a actividade e após o seu regresso de áfrica do sul, inicia a actividade de carpintaria como fonte para sobrevivência.
Actualmente tem o negocio (carpintaria) minimamente estável e conta com 5 empregados. Vende mais esquadria (postas e janelas) e vende, por exemplo uma porta a 2.000,00MT e consegue fazer 6 portas por mês.
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 14.000,00MT com o qual pretende comprar madeira.
Tem como plano futuro adquirir uma viatura para usar no transporte de matéria prima, quando terminar de pagar o credito.
texts.en:
Robert Carlos M. is 40 years old, he is married and has 5 children from different mothers. He studied until 8th grade, all his children study and are between the ages of 5 and 13. Roberto was born in Maputo and grew with his parents until he left to fulfill his obligatory military service duty at the time when the civil war was intense in his country. He went to South Africa with some friends, avoiding to be a soldier, where he worked for several years. When he came back to his country in 1990 he married his first wife and had 4 children, he later divorced her for social issues. He owns his home. Roberto married his current wife and they have a child 5 years ago. When he was in school, after classes he used to stop by a carpentry to appreciate the pieces and learn voluntarily to create objects and articles. He gained passion for the activity and after his return from South Africa, he started working in carpentry. Currently his carpentry business is stable and he has 5 employees. He sells more doors and windows, for example a door for 2,000MT and he builds 6 doors a month. He heard about Hluvuku-adsema from friends and this is his first loan for 14,000MT that he will use to buy wood. His future plans are to buy a vehicle to move supplies when he finishes paying his credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build wood articles, tables, doors and windows

loans.name: Osasunmwen

texts.en:
Osasunmwen is 52 years old and she is married with six children. She sells palm oil in wholesale and retail.

Osasunmwen hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She is saying thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica a go-getter and an ambitious lady who left employment as a civil servant in 2003. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. Besides this, she is taking care of an orphan who is studying nursing in a private college. With the rising cost of education and with a burning desire to see that her children get the best, she ventured into business. 

Having been a civil servant, she had already identified her target clients. She immediately started importing textile materials and selling them to her clients. With a need and demand for other accessories, she is now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of clothes, bed sheets and shoes.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes (purchase bed sheets and shoes)

loans.name: Thérèse Khoudia

texts.fr: Thérèse Khoudia T. est âgée de 53 ans et mère de 03 enfants à sa charge. Son activité est le commerce de manioc. Elle veut un prêt pour la renforcer. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Thérèse Khoudia T., age 53, is the mother of three children in her care. Her business involves commerce in cassava. She wants a loan to bolster her business. Her revenues allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell yuca (cassava)

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 23 years old and married with one young child: age one and a half years old. Jackline got married at a young age, when most of her peers had joined tertiary colleges, because she lacked school fees. With the challenge of raising a child and taking care of three siblings, she started a catering business. She signed a three year renewable contract with the local authority to enable her to supply food to children in Buruburu primary school. She currently prepares food for 500 pupils and has 10 employees.
She is borrowing Ksh. 50,000 to enable her to buy an oven and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget A. is 52 years old and is married with six children. She sells sarongs and drinks to make a living.

Bridget hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Isidro Fernando

texts.pt:
Isidro Fernando N. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de três filhos de idades compreendidas entre dois e nove anos e uma já freqüenta a escola. Estudou 12 classe tendo pausado para continuar no próximo ano ingressando no ensino superior.

Isidro trabalha como professor contratado numa das escolas de boane enquanto que a esposa faz pequenos negócios, vende produtos de primeira necessidade.
Saui da cidade de maputo no ano de 2004 juntamento com a sua esposa, logo depois que conseguiu o emprego no aparelho do estado e estando neste momento a trabalhar e a viver no distrito de Boane.

Tem como salário mensal 3.440,00mt que os aplica não sustento da família e de vezes enqunto, tem poupado na sua conta bancaria. No entanto nunca se beneficiou de um credito bancário com outras instituições sendo este o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua própria casa.
 
Isidro conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema graças as informações obtidas através de amigos que já eram clientes da instituição. Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos para terminar a sua casa e concluir o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Isidro Fernando N. was born in Maputo, he is 36 years old, married and has 3 children who are between 2 and 9 years old and are studying in school. he studied until the 12th grade having to pause he will continue next year to enter a higher education school. Isidro works as a teacher at one of the schools in Boane and his wife works on small business, selling first need groceries. Isidro left Maputo on 2004 with his wife and he obtained a governmental job in Boane where he currently works and lives. His salary is 3,440MT which he uses to support his family and from time to time he is able to save some money on his bank account. He never applied for a loan with other institutions so this will be his first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 10,000MT to buy construction materials to build his house. Isidro learned about Hlvuku-Adsema thanks to information provided by friends who were already members of the institution. He expects to pay the loan without problems and access more loans to finish building his house and go to higher education.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Carol A. is a single mother with one child, aged 5 years. She runs a coffin and furniture business. She has been operating this business for one year now. She solely depends on this business to pay rent, feed her family and pay school fees for her daughter. Her dream is to invest in her daughter through education and open branches in other regions. She is requesting a booster loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: Boost business by buying more timber

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy is married with two children. He has his own kiosk at the market where he sells clothing. He has been in this business for six years and his monthly income is 3,000 UAH. 

Besides market sales, Valeriy also goes around to neighboring villages in order to be closer to his clients. He has repeat clients that order items for him to bring back.

Valeriy is a responsible and hardworking person. Constant demand motivates him to develop his business further. He would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase his inventory. His business goal is to have a small shop with better conditions for his clients.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Pauline Arame

texts.fr: Pauline Arame T., 39 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Son activité est la vente  de bananes. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son capital. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline Arame T., age 39, is married and has nine children to support. Her business involves selling bananas. She is requesting a loan to boost her capital. The revenues from her commerce will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bananas

loans.name: Neves

texts.pt:
Neves K. nasceu na província de tete (dista a 1600 km a norte de Maputo) tem 48 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos todos em idade escolar.

Neves saiu da província de tete no ano de 1977 para maputo onde mais tarde foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório, continua soldado efectivo nas forcas armadas de Moçambique e exerce a tarefa de administrativo no quartel de boane. Continua a estudar estando a frenquentar a 10 clssse na escola secundária Joaquim chissano de Boane. Tem um salário mensal no valor de 6.000,00MT que dedica para o sustento da família (esposa e os seus 6 filhos) e uma parte paga a divida.
Neves conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema desde a sua implantação no distrito de boane através de informações obtidas dos colegas.

Nunca tinha tido empréstimos com outras instituições. Com a Hluvuku-Adsema, toma o quarto credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção da sua casa. Os primeiros créditos também foram para compra de materiais (7.500,00MT; 9.000,00MT e 15.000,00MT, respectivamente).

Já reuniu boa parte de material que é ampliar a sua moradia. Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para no futuro mais breve, para criação de frangos de corte assim como agricultura de rendimento.
texts.en:
Neves K. was born in the province of Tete, 1600 km north of Maputo. He is 48 years old and married, and has six school-age children. Neves left Tete in 1977 for Maputo, and was then drafted for compulsory military service. He is still a soldier in Mozambique's armed forces and is commander of the Boane headquarters. He is still in school, attending 10th grade classes in Joaquim Chissano School in Boane. He earns 6000 meticals a month, which he uses to support his wife and six children, and to pay off his debts. Neves has known about Hluvuku-Adsema since he was stationed in Boane. He heard about it through his colleagues. He's never received loans from other institutions. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 20,000 meticals to buy materials to build his house. His prior loans were also for this purpose (7500, 9000, and 15,000 meticals, respectively). He has already acquired a good bit of the materials needed to expand his house. He intends to pay off his loan quickly and without difficulty, and will raise chickens to subsist.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Nacy

texts.en: Nacy is 28 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Nacy hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
ROSALINA Francisco M. nasceu no distrito de Manhica (a 70 km da cidade de Maputo), de 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de seis filhos sendo três freqüentando escola e os restantes maiores de idade e com vida particular.

Rosalina tem 7 classe parou de estudar na altura da guerra. Sustenta também uma enteada com três filhos, que vive com ela na mesma casa, própria.
Rosalina transferiu se de manhica para vila de namaacha com a família (marido e os filhos) em missão de serviços do esposo no ano de 1988 que exerce a tarefa de docente.
  
Rosalina é Modista ( faz roupas para ambos sexos) a mais de 30 anos e trabalha sem empregado. Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade em casa com a sua mãe e mais tarde foi se formar numa escola de corte e costura a mais de 20 anos.
Com esta actividade consegue um rendimento mensal de 3.000,00MT que dedica para o pagamento da divida e alguma vez poupa num esquema tradicional.

Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e nunca tinha tido empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo credito no valor de 18.000,00MT para compra de material de construção. O primeiro empréstimo também foi para compra de material de construção no valor de 16.000,00MT.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais empréstimos e terminar a sua obra.
texts.en:
Rosalina Francisco M. was born in the district of Manhica (70km from Maputo), she is 45 years old, she is married and has 6 children, three of them go to school, and the other 3 are adults now with their own lives. Rosalina stopped studying when she was on 7th grade because of war in her country. She also supports a stepdaughter with 3 kids, who live in the same house. Rosalina moved from Manhica with her family (husband and children) because of her husband's mission working as a teacher back on 1988. Rosalina is a dressmaker (creates clothes for females and males) for the last 30 years and works without any employee. She learned this activity with her mother and later on she went to sawing and cutting school 20 years ago. With this activity she gets a monthly income of 3.000MT that she uses to pay her debt and sometimes is able to save too. She learned about Hluvuky-Adsema from friends and she never had loans with other banks before. This is her second loan for 18.000MT to buy construction material. Her first loan for 16.000MT was to buy construction material too. She expects to pay the loan without any problem to access more loans in the future to finish her construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles I. is 33 years old and he is married with two children. He sells medicines to make a living. Charles hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.pt:
Maria Estela Fernando Nhancumbe nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze (terra natal de Eduardo Mondlane, obreiro da Unidade nacional, província de Gaza que dista a 350 km de Maputo) tem 35 anos de idade e mãe de quatro filhos com idades compreendidas entre dois e 13 anos, sendo três filhos já freqüentando escola.

Maria cresceu junto aos seus pais e estudou ate 9 classe. Parou de estudar porque teve que casar muito cedo com o seu marido com o qual vive ate hoje. Depois que a situação social se estabilizou, este ano retomou com os estudos e freqüenta 10 classe na escola Secundaria de Boane, no curso noturno.

O seu marido é membro da Policia da Republica de Moçambique e ela trabalha como agente de serviços no Instituto Agrário de Umbeluzi de Boane a mais de 5 anos e ganha mensalmente o valor de 1.550,00MT. Vive também com mais duas sobrinhas que estão sob sua responsabilidade.

Maria nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu segundo credito no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção. O primeiro foi no valor de 10.000,00MT, também com o mesmo propósito.
Maria conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema graças às informações fornecidas pelos colegas de serviço.
Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir o murro de vedação e comprar uma viatura.
texts.en:
Maria Estela Fernando Nhancumbe was born in the district of Manajacaze (land of Eduardo Mondlane, worker of National Unity, province of Gaza that is 350km from Maputo) she is 35 years old and has 4 children, who's ages are between 2 and 13 years old, 3 of them are already in school. Maria grew with her parents and studied until the 9th grade. She stopped studying because she had to marry fast with her husband. After the social situation was more stable in the country, she went back to study and is currently in the 10th grade at Boane's High School, on the night shift classes. Her husband is a member of the Police if the Republic of Mozambique and works as service agent at the Agricultural Institute of Umbeluzi of Boane for the last 5 years and earns 1,550MT monthly. Two of her nieces also live with her and are under Maria's responsibility. Maria never had a loan with other institutions and this is her second loan for 12,000MT to buy material for construction. The first one was for 10.000MT for the same purpose. Maria learned about Hluvuku-Andsema thanks to the information offered by her husband's co-workers. She expects to pay without any problem to access more loans in order to build a blocking wall and buy a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Shadrach

texts.en: Shadrach is 44 years old and married with eight children. He sells electrical materials. Shadrach hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Laurinda Joao

texts.pt:
Laurinda João Objana C. nasceu no distrito de Magude (190 km a norte de Maputo) de 39 anos de idade e mãe de duas filhas sendo a mais velha com 9 anos e estando a estudar numa das escolas na cidade de Matola.

Maria concluiu a 12 classe e espera ingressar no superior logo que estabilizar a sua situação social (ter a casa própria completa). actualmente é separado e vive com as filhas e envia dinheiro para as suas irmãs que se encontram na cidade de maputo, ainda sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu de Magude juntamente com seus pais no ano de 1973 para Boane e em 1994 passou ao vizinho distrito de Moamba em missão se serviço e tendo depois regressado a Matola para se formar como docente. Actualmente é professora na Escola Primaria do trevo onde trabalha e vive a mais de 12 anos numa casa alugada, somente com suas filhas.
Tem um salário mensal no valor de 4.432,00MT que aplica no sustento da sua família.
Ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas de serviço e tendo aproximado e solicitar este seu primeiro credito no valor de 10.500,00MT para compra de materiais de construção. Espera pagar sem problemas para poder construir a sua própria casa, tomando mais empréstimos
texts.en:
Laurinda Joao Objana C. was born in the district of Magude (190km north of Maputo) she is 39 years old and has 2 daughters, the oldest is 9 years old and they study at a school in Matola. Maria finished the 12th grade and expects to enter higher education when the social situation stabilizes (when her own house is finished), currently she is separated and lives with her daughters and sends money to her sisters who are in the city of Maputo, who are under her responsibility. She left Magude with her parents back in 1973 to Boane and in 1994 went to the district of Moamba in a mission, then she went back to Matola to study to be a teacher. She is currently a teacher at a Primary school in Trevo where she has been working and leaving for the past 12 years at a rented house with her daughters. She has a monthly salary of 4,432MT that uses to support her family. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from coworkers and came to request her first loan for 10,500MT to buy construction materials. She expects to pay without problems to request more loans to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is divorced with one adult son. She owns a kiosk at the market and sells women's bathrobes as well as bedsheets. Natalia has been in this business for eight years. During this time she has been able to attract many repeat clients. Natalia has worked hard to develop her business. She always offers good, quality products and has a good discount policy, which helps her business to be a stable source of income. Natalia would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the assortment of items she sells. She hopes to use additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items she sells

loans.name: Mboye

texts.fr: Mboye T., 32 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de porcs et le commerce de boissons. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer ses activités. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mboye T., age 32, is married and has six children to support. She is active in raising pigs and in the beverages business. She is requesting a loan to bolster her businesses. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising pigs and for commerce in drinks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is 30 years old and is married with four children. She sells grocery store items. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery store items to sell

loans.name: Natalka

texts.en:
Natalka runs a small business selling sweets and bakery items in the central marketplace of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Natalka is married and has two kids. She has been in this business for seven years. Presently, she has about 45,000 hryven' in inventory. Her gross income is about 15,000 hryven'.

Natalka is requesting a loan of 13,000 hryven' to increase her turnover capital. Her business has always been characterized by consistent growth and stability. We believe the current loan will help Natalka keep her standing in these challenging economic times. Moreover, additional funding will assist her in her endeavors to open a second vending facility, which has been one of her long-term plans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is single. She lives and works in the small town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Oksana sells toys in the central market of her home town. Her vending kiosk is located right in the center of the marketplace. There are no other vendors with similar inventory at the market which helps Oksana’s business develop without having to face fierce competition. She has been in the trade for five years. Currently, Oksana has about 30,000 hryven' in inventory. Her monthly income is about 4,000 hryven'.

Oksana is seeking a loan of 10,000 hryven' to restock her merchandise. She is hoping to generate additional income to be reinvested in her business. One of Oksana’s plans for the future is to open a new vending location and expand her trade as a result. .

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, vive con sus hijos Deivi de 19 años, Kevin de 14 y Neyeli de 6 añitos. Ella tuvo que trabajar en varios oficios para sacar adelante a su familia, teniendo en mente que todo sacrificio es por sus hijos. Es así que desde hace 14 años, a base de mucho esfuerzo pudo implementar en su casa una pequeña ferretería. Su negocio va progresando poco a poco y ella espera muy pronto poder expandirlo, ya que cada día obtiene más clientela incrementando sus ganancias. Lo que le gusta a Carmen de su trabajo es que gracias a él puede ser independiente y lograr mantener las necesidades de su familia. Su trabajo es durante todo el día y aunque le resulta muy cansado permanecer durante bastante tiempo con el intenso frió de esta época, aún así trabaja con muchas ganas de progresar. Este es su cuarto préstamo don MFP, ella es parte del banco comunal denominado “Estrella azul”, donde se siente muy feliz con su grupo, puesto que todos son muy cumplidos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de artículos para abastecer mejor su ferretería e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old, native to the city of Lima. She lives with her children, 19 year old Deivi, 14 year old Kevin, and 6 year old Neyeli. Carmen has had to work various jobs to support her family, knowing that all her sacrifices have been for her children. 14 years ago, after much effort, she was able to set up a small hardware store in her house. Her business has been growing little by little and Carmen hopes to be able to expand it soon, since every day she gains more customers and earns more income. What Carmen likes about her work is that thanks to her business she can be independent and provide for her family. She works all day and although it leaves her tired to work such long hours in the intense cold during this time of year, Carmen continues working with a lot of motivation to make progress. This is her fourth loan with MFP. Carmen is part of "Estrella Azul" (Blue Star) community bank, and is very happy with her group, as the members are all very responsible. With the money she is requesting she will buy a greater quantity of items to better stock her hardware store and thus increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marguerite Ndew

texts.fr: Marguerite Ndew T., 40 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Son activité est le commerce de produits halieutiques (poissons fumés, poissons séchés, escargot de mer et  coquillage). Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son activité. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Marguerite Ndew T., age 40, is married and has four children to support. Her business involves commerce in seafood products (smoked fish, dried fish, whelk, and seashells). She wants a loan to bolster her business. Her revenues allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seafood products

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene vive con su pareja, quien es maestro constructor y por su buen trabajo viaja por distintos lugares para ejercer su labor. Ella a sus 35 años, tiene 4 hijos que están en edad escolar. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos, en diferentes modelos, pero más se inclina por la lencería, esta labor la realiza en un espacio dentro de su casa, que viene a ser como su pequeño taller. A Marlene se siente satisfecha de que sus clientes tienen confianza de su buena labor y la recomiendan con otras personas, lo que hace que su clientela crezca. Para un futuro cercano, Marlene quiere tener una tienda de ropa donde también venda las prendas que confecciona. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos los integrantes se comprender muy bien y son buenos amigos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará telas, hilos y otros materiales para confeccionar mayor cantidad de ropa y comercializarla ella misma.
texts.en:
Marlene lives with her partner, who is a master builder and travels to different places for his job. She is 35 years old and has 4 school-aged children. For the past 4 years, she has been selling different types of clothing for children and adults, but primarily lingerie. She works out of her home, which is like a tiny retail shop. Marlene is happy that her customers are satisfied with her work and recommend her to other people. This helps increase her clientele. In the near future, Marlene would like to open a boutique that sells designer clothing.

This is Marlene’s 5th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her communal bank because all the members understand one another and are very good friends. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase fabrics, thread and other materials to make high-quality clothing that she will sell herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, thread and other materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera y vive con su único hijo, quien tiene 15 años, estudia y le apoya mucho. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y pescado, según la temporada, en un kiosko instalado frente a su casa. El producto que le es más rentable es el pescado, el cual es de agua dulce, D. río que surca su ciudad, pero actualmente no es temporada, por lo que viene vendiendo frutas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene activa y es una labor tranquila. Además le es rentable porque cada día vende todos sus productos, debido a que se encuentra en un lugar muy transitado y Sadith se encarga de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes, quienes se sientes muy satisfechos por la acogida que les brinda. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que los integrantes son personas puntuales en sus pagos y se apoyan mutuamente. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más frutas y mandará a ampliar su kiosco, ya que necesita mejoras para dar una mejor vista a sus productos.
texts.en:
Sadith, 39, is a hard working woman. She is a single mother, and she lives with her only child who is 15. He goes to school and helps her a lot. For five years she has been selling fruit and fish, depending on the season, in a kiosk, which was installed in front of her house. Her most profitable product is the fish. It is fresh water fish from a river that runs through her city. But, it is not in season now, so she is selling fruit. What she likes about her work is that it keeps her active, and it is tranquil work. Also, it is profitable because she sells her products every day in a very busy location. Sadith makes sure she treats her customers well. They feel very satisfied with the way she makes them feel so welcome. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that the members are punctual in their payments, and they are supportive of each other. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit and to expand her kiosk. It needs some improvements to be able to better display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her kiosk and increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es: Tesalia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en la universidad de su localidad, y tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la venta de comida (platos variados, caldo de gallina y bebidas), todos los días, por las mañanas. Para su negocio mandó a construir una ramada (techo de madera y paja) frente a su vivienda y debajo acondiciona mesas y bancas para servir sus platos de comida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degusten de su buena sazón y darles una buena atención es lo que más le importa. Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque se encuentra en una zona muy transitada y sus clientes acuden diariamente a su puesto. Su deseo a futuro es llegar a tener un restaurante, por lo que seguirá trabajando duro para alcanzar esta meta. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es porque se apoyan entre sí y son muy responsables en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será lo invertirá íntegramente en su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Tesalia is 31. She lives with her husband, who works in the regional university, and their four school aged children. For two years she has been selling food (various dishes, chicken soup, and drinks) every morning. She had a ramada (wood and straw roof) built in front of her house for her business. Under the ramada there are tables and benches so she can serve her dishes. What she likes most about her work is that so many people enjoy her flavorful cooking. Giving them good service is the most important thing to her. Her business is profitable because it is in a busy area. Her customers come to her place every day. Her wish for the future is to have a restaurant. She will keep working hard to reach this goal. This is her third loan with MFP. She likes working with her group because they support each other and are very responsible with their payments. The money she is asking for will be used to invest in her food selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to invest in her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a widow. She lives in Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Mariya sells groceries in the central market of her hometown. She has been in this trade for 15 years. Currently, she has about 40,000 hryven' in inventory. Her income is about 4,000 hryven' a month.

Mariya is seeking a loan of 10,500 hryven' to diversify her merchandise and increase her profit as a result. She is happy to see her venture expand to the current extent. However, she would like to see it grow further and this is why she decided to seek lending assistance. We believe Mariya’s determination and hard work will help her repay the current loan and see all of her business plans fulfilled.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam G. est une jeune femme de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes au marché de Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant de nouveaux produits afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle
texts.en:
Enyonam G. is a young woman, 27 years old, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the marketplace in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.
