She wishes to use this loan to expand her business by buying new products to satisfy customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Brigitte F., 32 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans l’élevage et le commerce de moutons. Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Brigitte F., 32 years old and married, with 6 children in her care. Her business is the raising and selling of sheep. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her goal is to improve the condition of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling sheep

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine A. est une femme de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est commerçante de céréales à Kpalimé. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, mils riz, haricots pour la revente.
texts.en:
Célestine A. is a 40 year old woman, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She sells cereals and grains in Kpalimé. Célestine has been working in this business for almost 4 years and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to increase the size of her business and buy sacks of corn, milled rice and beans for resale.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, milled rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Yao Mawuko

texts.fr: Yao Mawuko A. est un homme de 44 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. il est revendeur de produits pharmaceutiques génériques depuis 2 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit louer un magasin et l’approvisionner de nouveaux produits afin de mieux satisfaire à la demande de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao Mawuko A., age 44, is married and the father of 5 children. He's been reselling generic pharmaceutical drugs for 2 years. He wishes to use this loan to rent a shop and supply it with new products, in order to better meet customer demand. He counts on this opportunity to improve the standard of living of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a shop and supply it with pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette N., 51 ans est mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Son activité est le commerce de pâte d’arachide et de niébé. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bernadette N., age 51 ans, is married and has one child to support. Her business consists in selling peanut butter and black-eyed peas. She wants to use this loan to bolster her business. Her income enables her to help with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling peanut butter and black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Thérèse Rose M

texts.fr: Thérèse Rose M F., 39 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans le commerce de bananes et  veut renforcer son activité qui marche bien dans cette zone de production de banane. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse Rose M F., age 39, is married and has 9 children to support. Her business consists in selling bananas and it works well in this area where bananas are produced. She wants to bolster her business. Her income enables her to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling bananas)

loans.name: Chantal Fatou

texts.fr: Chantal Fatou T., 38 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Son activité est le commerce de produits divers (huile, sucre, savons, riz et autres) dans une boutique. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Chantal Fatou T., age 38, is married and has 7 children to support. Her business consists in selling various products (oil, sugar, soaps, rice, ...). She wants a loan to bolster her business. Her income enables her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business (selling oil, sugar, soaps, rice, ...)

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Simaila is involved in the sale of dry goods as well as soap production. She has been in the business for the past four years in the Bassa town area. Simaila is a primary school dropout. She is married with four children ranging in age from 2 months – 10 years, with no dependent. One of her children is in the 2nd grade. She says her dream is to have a bigger business and to be able to educate all of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional goods and soap making products

loans.name: Progressive Youths Group

texts.en: Sunnyboy is a high-school dropout due to financial constraints. He doesn’t have any children but has one extended family member as a sibling. He’s involved in the sale of rice at retail prices, a business which he has been in for the past four years within the waterside market area. He’s successful due to good manners when approaching his customers and because he also offers a lower cost sometimes if there is a need. He dreams of a bigger business to help continue his education.

loans.use: Buy goods wholesale and sell retail

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Meléndez, casada, reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano de  58 años de edad, sus hijos independientes, su negocio es la venta de granos básicos, pollo , verduras y frutas, inicio este negocio con la venta de nacatamales para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Su meta es poder vender variedad de productos para crecer cada día más en las ventas. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo en cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos y carne. El cual espera obtener buenas ventas. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia M. is 58, married, and lives in the neighborhood Monsenor Lezcano. She has children, but they are now independent. Her business is the sale of staple grains, chicken, vegetables, and fruits. She started this business by selling Nacatamales to support her spouse with the family expenditures. Her goal is to be able to sell a variety of products in order to continuing growing her sales. This will be her 7th loan, and she plans to invest it in the purchase of staple grains and meat. She thanks Afodenic for the loans that it has already granted her and looks forward to putting this one to good use.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains and meat

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es: Don Anselmo Gutiérrez de 60 años, tiene una joyería que desde joven logro poner en el mercado oriental uno de los mercados mas visitados por los Nicaragüense por la variedad de producto que vende como su precio. El señor Anselmo reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano  tiene un hijo de 5 años que estudia su preescolar, con este préstamo que esta realizando es para comprar prenda de plata y poder seguir ofertando a sus clientes, espera poder incrementar de volumen su negocio. Da las gracias Afodenic por los logros obtenidos.
texts.en:
Anselmo G. is 60 years old, and has a jewelry shop which he has run out of the eastern market (one of the most popular markets for Nicaraguans) since he was young. Mr. Anselmo lives in the neighborhood of Monsenor Lezcano, and has a 5 year-old child who is in pre-school. With this loan, he plans to buy silver in order to continue offering good products to his customers and hopes to increase his volume of business. He thanks Afodenic for the achievements that he has had so far.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of silver

loans.name: Truth And Progress Group

texts.en: A. is freshman student at the university and two of his sister’s children (girls) are in his care. He’s been involved in the business of supplying electricity to business people who sell cold water and charge phones for about two years now. He’s successful by supplying stable current to his customers and approaching his customers well. He’s desirous of a bigger business and of being able to assist other extended family members.

loans.use: Another electric machine

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette M. est une femme mariée de 59 ans qui s’active dans la plantation  et le commerce de bananes. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter des intrants, du fumier, du gasoil et de payer la main d’œuvre pour la plantation de nouveaux pieds
texts.en:
Henriette M., age 59, is married and her business consists in growing and selling bananas. She wants to bolster it. The loan she's seeking will enable her to buy fertilizers, manure, fuel oil, and to pay workers for planting new trees.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and sell bananas

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en: M. is a 38-year-old Ghanaian who dropped out of junior high school. He is married and has 2 children. He decided to get into business seriously when he encountered some difficulty continuing school. He is a fisherman who is involved in the sale of fish brought from overseas. He has been in this business for the past six years. He dreams about generating enough money to switch to another business and be able to send his children to school, provide good meals, medical care, etc.

loans.use: Additional nets and make additional canoes

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en: Sayea has never been to school. She is married and has two children, ages 30 and 43 years old. Her husband is currently a college student. She has been selling dry goods, such as oil, pepper, and salt, for over 10 years in the Old Road area. She said, “My customers are attracted because I have more good on my table and approach my customers so well”. She dreams of having a bigger business to support herself and her grandchildren.

loans.use: Additional fresh goods for her sales table

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: El señor Marvin José tiene la edad de 44 años, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería y tiene doce años de administrarla, inicio solo vendiendo golosinas y gaseosa pero con los prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado ha podido ir incrementado sus ventas. Con este préstamo espera comprar granos básicos, lácteos, frutas y verduras para ofrecer a sus cliente una variedad de productos y poder obtener mejores ganancias para lograr solides en su. Negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por el crecimiento que ha logrado.
texts.en:
Sr. Marvin José is 44 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He has been operating a small grocery store for 12 years. He started selling only candy and sodas, and with the loans from AFODENIC, was able to increase his sales.

With this loan, Sr. Marvin hopes to purchase basic grains, dairy products, fruits and vegetables to offer his customers a variety of products and generate more revenue. He thanks the institution for the growth of his success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: Don Luis Eusebio tiene la edad de 43 años, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene 4 menores que estudian la primaria, sus planes es poder  mejorar el nivel de vida, el es taxista tiene doce años de trabajar en este servicio, el inicio trabajando como ejecutivo de ventas, y luego comenzó como cadete. Con este crédito quiere comprar batería para el carro como cambiar dirección del mismo para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito en Afodenic y da las gracias por apoyo ya que a través de ello ha logrado poder dar mantenimiento a su taxi. El cual es su fuente de ingreso para su familia. A futuro espera cambiar esta unidad de taxi para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Don Luis is 43 years old. He lives in Community 380 in the capital of Managua. He is married and has four children who are in primary school. He hopes to improve his life. He is a taxi driver. He has twelve years of experience in this job. He started working as a sales executive. Later he became a cadet. With this loan he wants to buy a battery for his car. This change of direction will bring better service to his customers. This is his second loan with Afodenic. He is thankful for the support. Through them he has been able to maintain his taxi. This is his main source of income for his family. In the future he hopes to buy a new taxi and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a battery and improve his taxi services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es: la joven Rosalina A., de 24 años de edad, es una mujer de iniciativa, soltera y vive con sus padres,  su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ropa, y prendas, desde hace tres años, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa como afanadora y con su liquidación inicio su negocio, con esta solicitud de crédito quiere invertir en la compra de joya, cosmético para a aumentar las ventas y poder obtener un mejor margen de ganancias, a si como captar clientes nuevos. Su meta es poder seguir estudiando en la universidad Mercadotecnia que por falta de capital hasta ahora no iniciado, pero lo lograra.
texts.en:
Rosalina A. is a 24 year old woman who is full of initiative. She is single and lives with her parents. For 3 years, she has been in the business of selling cosmetics, clothing and jewelry. She previously worked as a cleaning lady at an office, but when her employer went out of business, she applied for a loan so that she could buy jewelry to sell. Later, she started selling cosmetics to increase her sales and was able to achieve a better profit margin and attract new customers.

Her goal is to attend college and earn a degree in marketing. She doesn’t have the funds at the moment to enroll, but she eventually will.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28 year-old mother of 2 who runs a shop where she sells spare parts for motorbikes. Grace has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy stock and expand her business. She hopes to one day open a second location, and perhaps combine it with a business selling cell phones. Grace wants to give her two children, a 5 year-old boy and a 1 year-old girl, a bright future. She describes herself as open, friendly, and hard-working.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Magda tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio  Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, casada y con cuatro hijos mayores. Junto con su esposo ha logrado poner un negocio de destace de cerdo el cual lleva nueve años en el negocio en el destace. Inicio comprando poca cantidad pero luego ha venido invirtiendo. Con este crédito quiere  comprar cerdo y poder incrementar sus ventas, el cual le generara buenas ganancias. Sus planes es pode seguir creciendo en ventas, a si como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Magda is 39 years of age and lives in the Sabana Grande (Great Savannah) neighborhood of the capital of Manuagua. She is married and has four older children. Together with her husband she has been able to start a business butchering pigs which they have been doing for nine years. She started buying small quantities but later began investing. With this loan she wants to buy pigs so she can increase her sales which would generate good profits. Her plans are to be able to continue increasing her sales so she can help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Doña Marta tiene una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, el cual inicio con ahorro y la venta de un vehiculo que tenia. Tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casada, y con tres hijos que estudian, su esposo  trabajad como administrador de empresa, con este préstamo que esta solicitando espera invertir en  granos básicos, productos lácteos, entre otros productos que consume las familias Nicaraguenses. Sus planes a futuro  es poder incrementar su negocio a si como ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien. Da las gracias Afodenic por el los prestamos adquirido y  por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Doña Marta has a store where she sells a variety of products. She used her savings and the proceeds from the sale of a vehicle to start her business. She is 36 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. Her husband works as an office manager.

She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, dairy products, and other consumer goods that Nicaraguan families use. Her future plans are to expand her business and help her children with their education. She thanks AFODENIC for providing loans and the associated benefits she has gained.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains & dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Enlarge business premises

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham T. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through senior high school. Abraham has been selling fish in Bantoma since 1999. His wife is a trader. Abraham uses his income to pay school fees and other bills. Abraham will use the loan to purchase materials for fishing. Abraham plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: Abraham will use the loan to purchase materials for fishing.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac G. sells firewood and palm kernel oil in Ayisa. Isaac has received a primary school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Isaac has been selling firewood and palm kernel oil since 1993. He is responsible for paying bills and other expenses. His loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Adelante Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” (Women Moving Forward) is pictured here. On average, the women in this communal bank, which was created on October 20th 2008, have been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for less than a year. The majority of the communal bank’s members live in Pucallpa, in two different neighborhoods: “San Juan D. Miraflores” and “25 D. Marzo” (25th of March). 

Señora Susy Cárdenas Morí is 38 years old and is the president of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante.”  She has a business selling clothing. The communal bank has 12 members. The members trust one another. The group is small and its members are happy. They take their commitments seriously and view their businesses optimistically. As a group, they are requesting a loan of 5,800 Nuevos Soles, which each will invest in her business.  The women of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures, including selling new and used clothing, candy, snow cones, beauty products, CDs and DVDs of films or music videos, plantain chips and cooked food.  Two women plan to invest in making their first payments on motorcycle taxis.

Amongst themselves, the women speak of enjoying Manuela Ramos’s hymn, whose words caused them to reflect and inspired them toward further progress. (Each new bank member listens to this hymn about a Peruvian woman who tires of oppression and decides to develop her skills in order to improve her life). With the support offered to them by Manuela Ramos, the women of “Mujeres Hacia Adelante” will be able to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: food for catering businesses, other products for sale, and purchase of motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Rejoyce

texts.en: Rejoyce A. is married and has two children. She has received education through primary school. Rejoyce has been selling fish in Bantoma since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Rejoyce uses her income to support her husband and take care of the children. Rejoyce will use the loan to buy fresh fish from the fishermen, smoke the fish, and sell them. Rejoyce plans to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: Rejoice will use the loan to buy fresh fish from the fishermen

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort H. sells African wear, such as beads and other African jewelry, at the Castle. Comfort has received a senior-high-school education. She is a single parent and has 4 dependents .Comfort has been selling beads and other African jewelry since 2003. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more beads and other African jewelry to resell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more beads and other African jewelry to resell

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi G. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through primary school. Kofi has been selling spare car parts and operating a corn mill in Bantoma since 1994. His wife is a fishmonger. Kofi uses his income to pay school fees and other bills. Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts. He plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: Kofi will use the loan to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina T. sells cassava dough in Bantoma. Christina has received a primary school education.  She is a single parent and has three children. Christina has been selling cassava dough since 1998. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava dough to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin W. sells fish in Bantoma. Godwin has received a senior-high-school education.  He is married and has 6 dependents. His wife is a fishmonger. Godwin has been selling fish since 2001. He is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy fishing net for fishing. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from back into hs business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Esiaonam

texts.en: Esiaonam S. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Esiaonam has been selling processed fish in Bantoma since 1994. Her husband is a trader. Esiaonam uses her income to pay school fees and other bills. Esiaonam will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esiaonam plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Esiaonam will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard W. is married and has two children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Richard is a fisherman who goes fishing on the sea. He has been selling fish to the fishmongers in Bantoma since 2005. His wife is a trader. Richard uses his income to pay school fees and other bills. Richard will use the loan to buy fishing net and other equipment for fishing. Richard plans to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: Richard will use the loan to purchase buy fishing net and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina O. is a seamstress in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. She also sells sewing materials. Martina has received a vocational education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. Martina has been sewing and selling sewing materials since 1998. She is responsible for paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy sewing materials to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy sewing materials to sell.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
LA VECINDAD DEL CINCO


Hace 4 años se formo la Alcancía Comunal La Vecindad del Cinco todas viven en el AAHH Cinco D. Noviembre y tienen diferentes negocios que les permiten brindar lo necesario para sus pequeños hijos. La Sra Ermanda A. es la mayor D. su grupo  y  presidenta D. la alcancía, es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora que se dedica a la venta D. tubérculos, viaja constantemente para traer mejores productos a Lima.
La Sra. Ermanda es pieza fundamental en su ALCOM, inspira respeto y seguridad.

Las socias tienen diferentes tipos D. negocio, tales como: vidriería, costura, venta D. comida, pequeñas  bodegas y la venta D. tubérculos. La mayoría son madres solteras y tienen mucho entusiasmo para salir adelante. Ellas saben que tienen mucha competencia y es por eso que renuevan constantemente su stock D. productos.

Ellas están contentas con los préstamos, pero desean aumentar sus ventas comprando insumos y productos que les permita obtener mas ganancias. .
texts.en:
La Vecindad del Cinco Community Bank La Vecindad del Cinco Community Bank was formed four years ago. All of them live in the AAHH Cinco D. Noviembre. They have different businesses, which allow them to proviD. the necessities to their small children. Ermanda A. is the oldest, and she is president of the group. She is a very active and enterprising woman. She sells tubers. She is constantly traveling so that she can bring better products to Lima. Ermanda plays a fundamental role in her ALCOM. She inspires respect and confidence. The members have different types of businesses like a glass shop, sewing, food sales, small mini markets, and tuber sales. Most of them are single mothers, and they are very enthusiastic about getting ahead. They know that they have a lot of competition. That is why they are constantly restocking their products. They are happy with the loans, but they want to increase their sales by buying supplies and products that will allow them to get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph Y. is married and has two children. He has received schooling through middle school and has earned his Middle School Leaving certificate (MSLC). Joseph has been selling used electrical appliances, such as TV sets, in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast since 1994. His wife is a secretary. Joseph uses his income to pay for school fees. Joseph will use the loan to purchase used electrical appliances to resell. He plans to reinvest the new profits in his business.

loans.use: Joseph will use the loan to purchase used electrical appliances to resell

loans.name: Tidjani Shaibu

texts.en: Tidjani Shaibu A. sells electrical appliances at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Tidjani Shaibu has received technical institutional training.  He is married and has 10 dependents. His wife is a trader. Tidjani Shaibu has been selling electrical appliances since 1993. He is responsible for paying school fees. His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell. He hopes to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis M. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through middle school. He has an MSLC (middle school leaving certificate). Francis has been selling electrical appliances in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast since 2003. His wife is a trader. Francis uses his income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Francis will use the loan to purchase more electrical appliances and expand the business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to pay school fees and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Francis will use the loan to purchase more electrical appliances and expand his business.

loans.name: Isaac Ken

texts.en: Isaac Ken S. sells phone and phone accessories in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Isaac Ken has received a senior high school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Isaac Ken has been selling phone and phone accessories since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. His loan will be used to buy phone and phone accessories to resell. He hopes to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy phone and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright A. is a single parent and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Bright has been selling fish in Ayisa since 2002. Bright uses his income to pay school fees. Bright will use the loan to buy materials for fishing. Bright plans to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: Bright will use the loan to buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. sells frozen fish in Ayisa. Victoria has received a primary schooleducation. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Victoria has been selling fish since 1999. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
			LUZ D. LA ESPERANZA

La Alcancia Comunal Luz D. la Esperanza está representada por la presidenta Lorry S. y cursan el noveno ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad. Este grupo realiza diferentes actividades relacionadas con el comercio, venta D. comida, costura y manualidades. 

La Sra Lorry tuvo un negocio D. cebicheria que  en su momento le dio muchos beneficios, pero lamentablemente por problemas D. salud tuvo que cerrar su negocio; estos problemas le impedían movilizarse, entonces comenzó  un negocio que le permitia desenvolverse en casa,    fue así  que pudo estudiar algunos cursos D. cosmetología y enfermería, que  le permitió mantener a sus hijos, ya que se había separado  D. su esposo hace varios años. 

AhO. ella tiene toda una cartera D. clientes a los cuales atienD. mensualmente. Además venD. productos para el cuidado del cabello.
Los beneficios que ha obtenido han sido D. mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa y seguir pagando la educación D. sus hijos.

El crédito otorgado a ella y a los demás socios será destinado para la compra D. insumos para los diferentes negocios que tienen cada una.
Y así poder brindarles a sus familias lo indispensable para vivir.
texts.en:
Luz D. Esperanza Community Bank The Luz D. Esperanza Community Bank is represented by its president, Lorry S.. They are in their ninth loan cycle, and they have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility. This group has different activities related to sales like food sales, sewing, and handicrafts. Lorry had a “cevicheria” (a restaurant specializing in ceviche and other seafood dishes), which gave her many benefits. Sadly, she had to close the business for health reasons, which impeded her mobility. She then started a business which allowed her to manage it at home. She could study some courses on cosmetology and nursing. This allowed her to support her children. She separated from her husband several years ago. Now she has a good customer base that she tends to every month. She also sells hair care products. The benefits she has gotten have been to improve the infrastructure of her house and to keep paying for her children’s education. The loan given to her and the other members is to buy supplies for the different businesses that each one of them has. That way they can give their families the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Leyla Alicia

texts.es: La señora  Leyla Alicia tiene 33 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de repostería, frescos, frijoles cocidos, tiene cuatro años de estar invirtiendo en este negocio, reside en el barrio Reparto Schick en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 9 años que cursa la primaria, madre soltera. Su negocio lo inicio con la necesidad de salir adelante con su hijo, con la venta de helados, refresco, sopas baho, y a si comenzó haciendo clientela. Con este crédito espera invertir en materia prima para elaborar repostería para esto va a comprar harina, aceite, azúcar, manteca entre otros productos. Sus planes es poder aumentar su negocio, apoyar a su hijo a que estudie. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Leyla Alicia is 33 years old. Her business is the sale of baked goods, soda, and cooked beans. She has invested in this business for four years. She lives in the Reparto Schick neighborhood of the capital city Managua. She has a 9 year old son who is in elementary school. She is a single mother. Her business began with the necessity of getting ahead with her son, by selling ice cream, soda, and "baho" soup (a mixture of meat, plantains, and yucca cooked in banana leaves), and in this way she began gaining customers. With this loan she hopes to invest in the raw materials for making baked goods. For this she will buy flour, oil, sugar, and butter, among other products. Her plans are to enlarge her business and support her son in his studies. She is thankful to the institution for the support to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter and sugar among others

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the communal bank "Rubi" whose members have been working with Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, for just four months. This communal bank was created on March 2009.  The majority of its members live in Pucallpa in a neighborhood called "26 de Enero" (26th of January). Señora Medita Chávez R. is 24 years old and is the president of "Rubi."

"Rubi" has 11 members. The members have confidence in one another. The group is small and the women are cheerful.  They take their commitments seriously and view their businesses optimistically. The members of "Rubi" are requesting a loan of 4800 Nuevos Soles in total, which each woman will invest in her business. This will be the second loan that the members have received from Manuela Ramos. The members of "Rubi" dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures, including selling plantains, other fruits and vegetables, rice, handicrafts, fish, basic grocery items, and cooked food.

The members of this bank are pleased to be receiving economic support from Manuela Ramos. Manuela Ramos also gives educational sessions during each monthly meeting, programming which helps the women to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Additional products for sale (including fruits and vegetables, other grocery items); investment in materials for handicrafts and a restaurant business

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sonia tiene la edad de 34 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace cuatro años administra, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio en la venta de tortilla y destace de cerdo. Reside en el barrio Máximo Jerez  y tiene un hijo de 6 meses. Este negocio lo iniciaron con  la liquidación de su trabajo ya que ambos trabajaban en zona franca. Con este crédito es su cuarto ciclo el cual invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos, carnes entre otros productos. Sus planes es poder seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Sonia is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Máximo Jérez. She is married and the mother of a son of 6 months.

She has been running a convenience store for four years. Her husband helps her in her business by selling tortillas and pork. They started this business with their redundancy pay when both their jobs in the duty-free zone were shed.

This is Sonia's fourth loan. She will use it to buy basic grains, dairy products, meat and other items. She hopes to be able to continue investing in her store and increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products and meat

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine B. is married and has 5 dependents. He received schooling through M S L C. Augustine has a small grocery store where he sells provisions at Beseasi in Elmina, which he has done since 1999. His wife is a trader. Augustine uses his income to pay for school fees and bills. Augustine will use the loan to purchase more provisions. With the new profits from his expanded business, Augustine plans to reinvest.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Dios Proveerá Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the communal bank “Dios Proveerá” (God Will ProviD.), whose members have been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about four months.  The majority of the women live in the Manantay district in the city of Pucallpa.  Señora Loysi P. P. is 27 and is the president of “Dios Proveerá.”

“Dios Proveerá” has 12 members who are cheerful and seem to work well together.  The group is still small and its members are optimistic about their businesses.  They are requesting a loan of 8,200 Nuevos Soles in total, which each member plans to invest her portion in her business.  This will be the group’s second loan with Manuela Ramos.  The members of “Dios Proveerá” are taking seriously their commitment to make their loan payments.  The women of this communal bank dedicate themselves to a variety of businesses including selling basic grocery goods, clothing, shoes, sheets, plantains, jewelry, soda, juice and cooked food.  

The women are grateful to Manuela Ramos for the economic support provided by the organization.  They are also happy to have the educational sessions conducted by Manuela Ramos loan officers at their monthly meetings,  as these sessions will help them to further develop their businesses.

loans.use: Various goods for sale; raw materials for preparing juices and cooked foods

loans.name: Virgen De La Asunción Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Virgen D. L. Asunción, se encuentra ubicado en L. comunidad D. Cuenca, L. cual pertenece al departamento D. Huancavelica. 

Liduvina es viuda y tiene 06 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. granos, los cuales en un inicio compraba D. casa en casa. Ahora manda a moler los granos, los cuales venD. en cada feria que pueD. asistir. Poco a poco su negocio esta creciendo, gracias a los prestamos que recibe. ElL. esta ahorrando para L. educación D. sus hijos y llegar a tener su propio molino, donD. elL. pueda moler sus granos.

Martha con el primer préstamo que recibió, compró gaseosas y refrescos, actividad a L. cual se dedica hasta ahora. Pese a L. competencia que existe en su rubro, elL. a podido sacar el negocio adelante, generándole mas ganancias, las cuales se encuentra ahorrando para poder comprar un vehiculo y así poder trasladar su mercadería.

Celsa tiene 05 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. granos, los cuales en un inicio compraba D. casa en casa. Ahora manda a moler los granos, los cuales venD. D. feria en feria. Su negocio ha ido incrementándose desD. que inició con sus prestamos, los cuales le han ayudado mucho, incluso a cambiar su calidad D. vida y L. D. sus hijos. Con sus ahorros, esta pensando abrir una bodega donD. ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. L. Asunción Community Bank is located in the Cuenca community, which belongs to the Huancavelica department. Liduvina is a widow with six children. She sells grains. When she started, she bought them going door to door. Now she has the grains ground and sells them at every fair that she can attend. Little by little, her business is growing, thanks to the loans that she receives. She is saving for her children’s education and to be able to have her own mill where she can grind her grains. With her first loan, Martha bought soft drinks and drinks. That is her business up until now. In spite of the competition that exists in her field, she has been able to get ahead in her business and generate more earnings. She is saving her earnings to be able to buy a vehicle. That way she can transport her merchandise. Celsa has five children. She sells grains. She started out buying door to door. Now she has the grains ground and sells from fair to fair. Her business has been increasing since she started with her loans. They have helped her a lot; they have changed the quality of her and her children’s lives. With her savings she is thinking of opening a mini market where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Yenni es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yenni tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Yenni vende salchipapas por las noches en la puerta de su casa.
Yenni necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Yenni es ampliar su local y tener mas ahorros.
texts.en:
Yenni is a member of the Nobleza Community Bank. Yenni is 30, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Yenni has a store in her house. She sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat. She does this every day. Yenni also sells “salchipapas” (fries with sliced sausage covered in various sauces) in the evenings. She sells them from the door to her house. Yenni needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Yenni’s dreams are to expand her location and to have more savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Sonia es conviviente tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Sonia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende carne, Sonia viaja a las diferentes ferias y la ciudad de Lima a comprar animales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Sonia son comprar un carro para transportar los animales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Nobleza community bank. She is 33 years old, partnered and the mother of 4 children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meat. Sonia travels around to different market fairs and to Lima to buy animals, work that she does with her husband's help. She needs a loan for 1200 soles that she will use to buy pigs. Her hopes for the future are to buy a vehicle for transporting the animals and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs for meat business.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Doña Rosa Maria tiene la edad de 43 años, casada su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, tiene seis años de elaborar las ricas rosquillas y perreque el cual inicio con dinero propio y con deseo de superación por apoyar  a su familia, sus planes es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, a si como la elaboración de otro hormo en su casa de habitación para producir mas rosquillas. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las rosquillas va  a comprar: maíz, queso, manteca, dulce y otros productos para hacer sus ventas y poder tener mejores ganancias al invertir y vender más. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamo ya que ha salido a delante con su negocio
texts.en:
Doña Rosa María is 43 years old, married and the mother of two children who are studying. Her husband works in agriculture. She lives in the neighborhood of Sabana Grande in the capital city of Managua.

She has been producing her delicious donuts for six years. She started her business with her own money. She wants to support her family and help her children in their studies. She plans to install another oven in her home to produce more donuts.

Rosa María will use this loan to buy ingredients for her donuts, namely corn, cheese, butter, candy and other items. By investing and selling more she expects to earn more profits. She thanks her lenders for this loan which will boost her business.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese and butter

loans.name: Triny Zoraida

texts.es:
Triny es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Triny es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Triny tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende carne variada, Triny viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra los animales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Triny necesita un préstamo de 1000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Triny son ahorrar para tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Triny is a member of the Nobleza community bank. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has a stand at the F. Vivanco market where she sells various meats. Triny travels to different market fairs in the region where she buys animals, work that she does with her husband's help. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she will use to buy pigs. Her hopes for the future are to save enough to buy a house and to give her children good educations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs for meat business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Lucy es soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Lucy es artesana y realiza bellos trabajos en telares como pasadizos, frazadas, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado F. Vivanco. Además Lucy vende quesos de casa en casa.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos y pintura.
Los sueños de Lucy son tener casa propia, ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Nobleza community bank. She is 32 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. She is an artisan and makes beautiful woven products such as shawls and blankets that she then sells at the F. Vivanco market. She also sells cheeses from her house. Lucy needs a loan of 800 soles, money that she will use to buy thread and paint. Lucy's hopes for the future are to own her own house and to save for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El joven Victor Hugo es originario de la zona uno del departamento de Totonicapán su principal actividad es la distribucion de huevos en el municipio de Totonicapan y sus comunidades, con dicha activida se gana la vida diariamente, desde niño trabajo en una granja de polluelos en donde se le dio la aoprtunidad de vender el producto y que se lo daban acieto precio cada día aumenta su demanda y la cual necesita de un credito y visita las oficina de ASDIR para ayudarlo y con ello comprar mas cajas de huevos y poder atender la demanda se sus clientes.
texts.en:
Young Victor Hugo is a native of Zone One in the "departamento" of Totonicapan. He operates a business delivering eggs in and around the town of Totonicapan. He makes enough from the business to live on. He's worked on a poultry farm since he was a child and was given the opportunity to sell the product at a set price. Demand is increasing by the day which is why Victor needs a loan. He went to ASDIR to apply for the loan and he'll use the money to buy crates of eggs so that he can meet the demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Bernardo es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo vende productos variados como radios, frazadas, ollas, platos, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y platos.
Bernardo sueña con tener una tienda, una fabrica de ollas.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the Nobleza community bank. He is 42 years old, partnered and the father of 2 children. He sells a variety of products such as radios, blankets, pots and dishes. He buys the products in the city of Ayacucho and sells them in different market fairs in his home region. Bernardo needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that he will use to buy pots and dishes. Bernardo's hope for the future is to own a store and a factory for making pots.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Laura Josefina

texts.es:
Laura es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Laura es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Laura tiene un taller de confecciones llamado DIORS, para lo cual cuenta con 5 personas que trabajan con ella en la confección de prendas a medida.
Laura necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de botones, cierres.
Laura sueña con tener una tienda, boutique y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank group “Nobleza”. She is 52 years old, married and has 3 children. Laura has a workshop called DIORS, which employs 5 people who make clothing according to specified measurements.

Laura needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase buttons and zippers. She dreams of owning a boutique and purchasing a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buttons & zippers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, negocio que administra con la ayuda de su sobrina, además Elizabeth vende dulces en su casa y tiene un pequeño tópico. Elizabeth tiene proyectado implementar una agencia de turismo.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la implementación de la agencia de turismo.
Lo sueños de Elizabeth son tener estabilidad en el negocio, implementar la empresa de turismo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank group “Nobleza”. She is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child. She operates an Internet café out her home and is assisted by her niece in running that business. Elizabeth also sells candy and runs a small dispensary. She has plans to open a travel agency.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 2000 soles to pay for expenses related to starting her travel agency. She dreams of getting her travel venture up and running, and that it becomes an established business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a travel agency

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Eugenia es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Eugenia vende cereales y menestras en el mercado de la ciudad de Cañete que se ubica a 6 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los cereales los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Eugenia sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank.
Eugenia is 52 years old, married and has three children. Eugenia sells cereals and legumes at the market in the city of Cañete, which is located six hours from the city of Ayacucho. She buys the cereals at Ayacucho’s wholesale food market.
Eugenia needs a 1,000 PEN loan to purchase cereals.
Eugenia dreams of improving her business and giving her daughters a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Fredy Geovani

texts.es: Don Fredy es originario de la zona uno del departamento de Totonicapan  su fuente de ingreso es la prestacion de servicio  de transporte para jovenes y señoritas estudiantes  de los diferentes centros educativos y la diferentes universidades de la ciudad de Quetzaltenago el inicio su negocio hace diez años con un bus hoy en dia tiene tres buses el necesita de un credito para mantener sus buses en buen estado y brindar un servicio a los pasajeros y con los ingreso que se obtiene le permite mejorar su nivel de  vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Fredy is originally from District #1 of Totonicapan Province. He makes his living providing transportation services to school children and female college students to the different schools and universities in the city of Quetzaltenago. He started his business with only one bus, but now he operates three buses in order to keep up with demand.

He needs a loan to maintain his buses in good condition so that he can continue providing service to his passengers. With his earnings, Don Fredy hopes to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Eddy Francisco

texts.es: El señor Eddy G. de 42 años de edad, reside en el  reparto los Cedros, comarca Villa del Carmen del municipio de Managua, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene tres hijos de 22, 15 y 18 años, todos los tienen estudiando. Los planes para su familia es brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, mejorando sus condiciones de  vida. Don Eddy se desempeña en el cargo de sub-director catastral desde el inicio del nuevo Gobierno en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen, anteriormente trabajaba como Maestro de obras de un proyecto para el desarrollo. Se le ha presentado dificultades para culminar su meta de construir su vivienda por falta de financiamiento. Da las gracias a  Afodenic por el préstamo,  ya que es un beneficio para  hacer las mejoras para de su vivienda el cual realizara la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, ladrillos y piedrines para el cambio de piso en la parte de la cocina y sala.
texts.en:
Eddy G., aged 42, lives in Los Cedros in the neighborhood of Villa del Carmen in Managua. His wife stays at home. They have three children, aged 22, 18 and 15, who are all studying. He strives to provide his children with a better future by improving their living conditions. Since the institution of the new Government, Eddy has been working in the city hall of Villa del Carmen as a deputy director in the land registry office. Before that he managed a development project.

Eddy was confronted with difficulties to complete the building of his home for lack of funding. Thanks to Afodenic, he will use this loan to make improvements to his home. He will buy building materials such as cement, bricks and gravel to get a new floor in the kitchen and the living room.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to get a new floor in his home

loans.name: Keita Nelly

texts.es:
Keita es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Keita es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Keita viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende papa, panes y de las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en harina, producto que vende en la ciudad de Pisco.
Keita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada.
Los sueños de Keita son ahorrar para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Keita is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She travels to the different markets in the region selling potatoes and bread. While at the markets, she buys grain for processing into flour, which she then sells in the city of Pisco.

Keita needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy barley. She dreams of saving enough money to purchase a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura  es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Maura es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijos, Maura viaja a las diferente ferias D. L. región en donD. compra cereales, que luego comercializa en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Maura en los últimos meses inicio con L. venta D. pollos en el mercado Playa Grau.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 400 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. pollo.
Los sueños D. Maura son tener una tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 28 years old, single, and has one child. She travels to the different markets in the region buying grain and then sells it to merchants in the city of Ayacucho. In recent months, Maura began selling chickens at the Playa Grau Market.

Maura needs a loan of 400 soles to buy chickens. She dreams of having a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
TeofiL. es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
TeofiL. es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, TeofiL. compra y venD. lana D. oveja, actividad que realiza D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central, además TeofiL. venD. quesos D. casa en casa.
TeofiL. necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. lana.
Los sueños D. TeofiL. son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
TeolfiL. is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 58 years old, married, and has 7 children. She buys and sells wool as a traveling merchant in the central market. TeofiL. also sells cheese door-to-door.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase more wool. TeofiL. dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Álvaro S. tiene 35 años, casado su esposa es ama de casa, con casa propia, vive en la comunidad de Villa del Carmen desde hace más de nueve años. Su esposa es de profesión Ingeniera agrónoma y de especialidad suelos tanto el como ella  tienen un proyecto de sembrar en su finca diferentes productos de granos básicos como maíz, trigo y frijoles. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa de Carmen en el cargo de concejal en este nuevo gobierno anteriormente en el departamento de administración en accesoria legal desde hace 8 años. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, azulejos y tuberílla para la remodelación de la cocina y a su vez ampliarla. Y poder ofrecer a su familia una casa digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Álvaro S. is 35 years old, married, and has lived in his own home in the Villa del Carmen community for more than 9 years. His wife is an agricultural engineer by profession and specializes in studying soils. She currently has a project that involves planting different farm products such as corn, wheat and beans. Sr. Álvaro is an alderman in the newly elected government for the town of the Villa del Carmen. Previously, he worked in the Department of Administration as a paralegal for 8 years.

Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, tiles and pipes to remodel and enlarge his kitchen. This will provide his family with a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel his kitchen

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Ninfa es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Ninfa viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, frutas, pollo y de las ferias compra animales menores, quesos, productos que son comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. También vende ropa en las ferias.
Ninfa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Los sueños de Ninfa son tener un puesto estable y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a member of the communal bank group “Confianza” (Trust). She is 38 years old, married, and has 6 children. She travels to different markets in the region selling vegetables, fruits, and poultry. While at the markets, Ninfa buys young animals, cheese, and other products which she then sells in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells clothing.

Ninfa needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy various types of clothing. She dreams of having a stable vending location and operating a grocery store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of clothing

loans.name: Patricia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Patricia de los Ángeles P. M. tiene 33 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que depende de ella. Patricia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una mujer que piensa en el futuro, por lo que sus esposo labora como docente, el imparte clases en las modalidades nocturnas, ya que los dos son personas que les gusta trabajar para proporcionarle a su hijo lo más importante. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo, con el dinero podrá comprar productos como pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, perfumes, colonias, talcos y cremas. Patricia tiene como aspiración proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda y que su hijo logre finalizar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Patricia de los Ángeles P. M. is 33 years old, married and the mother of a son for whom she cares. Patricia has been selling cosmetics for over 11 years. She is a woman who believes in her future. Her husband is a teacher and gives evening classes. Both like to work and provide for all the needs of their child.

Patricia applied for this loan to increase her working capital. She will use the money to buy various cosmetics such as nail polish, lipsticks, perfume, eau de cologne, talcum powder and creams. Patricia's goal is to improve her home and ensure the professional success of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La Señora María Antonieta Gutiérrez O.  tiene la edad de 34 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Pero es importante resaltar que su esposo contribuye en los gastos del hogar, su negocio nace con el objetivo de proporcionar ingresos para su familia, ya que con este humilde negocio fue la única forma para que sus hijos pudieran estudiar. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, jugos, gaseosas y granos básicos. La Señora María tiene las aspiraciones de mantener su negocio y lograr obtener más recursos para surtir su inventario.
texts.en:
María Antonieta Gutiérrez O. is 34 and married. She has two dependent children. She has had a mini market for over ten years. Her husband contributes to the household expenses. She started her business to get income for her family. This humble business was the only way that her children were able to go to school. The loan is for working capital to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, bread, juice, soft drinks, and basic grains. María aspires to keep her business and obtain greater resources to be able to stock her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petrona Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Petrona es originaria de la comunidad de Coxom del municipio de Totonicapán a  ocho kilometros de la ciudad su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta articulos de consumo diario y como el servico de molino de Nixtamal ella viene ejerciendo dicha actividad desde que hera una ñiña ya que el el ingreso de sus queridos padres y por ser la unica hija la heredaron dicha activida y que hasta la fecha lo ha podido mantener ella visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicita un credito la cual le servira para ampliar sus productos principalmente en la compra de tarjeta de telefonos ya que por su comunidad  son muy solictados la tarjetas ya que la mayoria de persona utilizan un telefono celular.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona is originally from the Coxom community in the town of Totonicapán, which is eight kilometers away from the city. Her main sources of income are selling daily household products and renting out her Nixtamal grinder (a brand name apparatus for milling corn and other grains). She has been working since she was a young girl and always helping her parents generate an income. Since she is the only child, Doña Petrona inherited the business and has been able to keep it going.

She came to the ASDIR office to request a loan so that she can increase her inventory of products, primarily to buy phone cards. These cards are widely sold in her community because most people have a mobile phone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital

loans.name: Ulises  Francisco

texts.es: El señor Ulises M. de 36 años de edad, reside en la comarca los cedros de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, casado, su esposa es maestra tiene cuatros hijos de 10, 7,4 y 6 meses. Los planes a corto plazo es mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda y a largo plazo que sus hijos tenga los mejores estudios. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen con el cargo de Director de Registro Civil desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba en la intendencia de la propiedad como analista castratal. Tiene terrenos en dónde quiere cultivar pero por dificultades de efectivo que no le prestan las cantidades necesaria para la inversión en las tierras el aumento en su trabajo ha sido poco.  Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra sembrar en las arias que no había abarcado con la compras de semillas y abonos. Son dos manzanas de tierra de ella solo una manzana esta cultivada  de maíz. Con el préstamo lograra cultivar  trigo. Obteniendo mayores utilidades y ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Ulises M. is 36, married, and he lives in the Los Cedros region of the Villa del Carmen community. His wife is a teacher. They have four children; ages 10, 7, 4, and 6 months. The short-term plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house. The long-term plan is for his children to have the best education. He works in the mayor’s office in Villa del Carmen. He has been the Director of Civilian Records for six months. He previously worked in property management as an analyst. He has land that he would like to cultivate, but he has money problems. They do not lend him the amount he needs to invest in his land. His work has increased very little. Thanks to a loan from Afodenic, he will be able to plant in the areas that he had not covered with the purchase of seeds and manure. He has two plots of land, and only one of them is planted with corn. With the loan, he will be able to plant wheat. He will then get greater use and earnings for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure to start planting

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Unidad En Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario llamado Unidad en Cristo está conformado por María Auxiliadora R. B. y Factora M. B.. Las dos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, María Auxiliadora tiene 56 años, y se dedica a una pulpería, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella es una mujer que ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que la vida le ha presentado. Es por eso que decide unirse con su amiga Factora M. para solicitar el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que la actividad de Factora es la venta de ropa, ya que ambas han trabajado muy fuerte para salir adelante. El sueño que ambas comparten es que Dios les siga proporcionando vida para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group "Unidad en Cristo" is formed by María Auxiliadora R. B. and Factora M. B.. They have different business activities. María Auxiliadora, aged 56, runs a local store and cares for four children. She is a woman who has managed to seize the opportunities that life has presented her. That is why she decided to join her friend Factora M. to request funding for working capital. Factora, for her part, sells clothes. Both have worked very hard to get ahead. They share the dream that God keeps on giving them strength in their life to continue their work.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Huanupampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen D. Huanupampa es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Primer ciclo con 10 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Huanupampa, distrito D. Totos, Provincia D. Cangallo, Departamento D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales son la agricultura y ganadería.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, animales menores, frutas, comida.

Como es el caso D. Margarita es presidenta del Banco Comunal, casada, Margarita tiene su tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, además brinda servicio telefónico y realiza recepción D. llamadas, también compra cereales.

Mientras que Gregoria es casada, tiene 3 hijas, Gregoria se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, como oveja, gallina, los cuales son comercializados en la feria D. su distrito. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 6300 soles, 500 soles, haciendo un total D. 3,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. queso, verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen D. Huanupampa Community Bank is aprt of the Wari project. The Community Bank started its first cycle with 10 member. The members are from the Huanupampa community, Totos district, Cangallo Province, Ayacucho Department. The activities are primarily agriculture. The members are in different businesses like the sale of general goods, grains, young animals, fruits and food. Like the case of Margarita is the President of the Community Bank and is married. Margarita has her store in her home and also gives out telephone calls and receives calls, and buys grains. Meanwhile, Gregoria is married with three children. Gregoria is dedicated to raising young animals, like sheep and hens, which are sold in the fair in her district. The members need different amounts of loans like 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, making a total o 3200 soles in loans in the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes and soda The dreams of the members are to have their own house, that their children are professionals, and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cheese, vegetables, potatoes, rice, sugar a soda

loans.name: San Antonio De Luricocha Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Antonio D. Luricocha inicia su primer ciclo con 15 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Luricocha que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Huanta, las actividades principales D. la zona son la agricultura y ganadería, los productos principales son palta y tara.
 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. joyas, golosinas, medicina natural, bebidas, comida, abarrotes en general y crianza D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,000 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Antonio D. Luricocha Cooperative Bank is beginning their first cycle with fifteen members. The members are from the Luriocha District that is located 15 minutes from the city of Huanta. The main activities of this zone are agriculture and ranching. Avocados and peas are the main agricultural products. The members of the cooperative engage in different businesses. They sell jewelry, candy, natural medicine, drinks and general groceries. They also work in animal husbandry. The members need to borrow different amounts of money such as 300 soles, 400 soles, or 600 soles. The total amount of the loans requested from the Cooperative Bank is 9,000 soles. The loans will be used for the purchase of rice, sugar, drinks, candies and young animals. The members’ dream of expanding their businesses. They hope that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, drinks, candies and young animals.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La señora Maria Estela es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac ella estuvo viviendo varios años en la ciudad de Guatemal y la cual estuvo trabajando en dependiente de Mostrador y hace cinco años empezo su propio negocio en la venta de articulos de consumo diario en su propia comunidad ella visita las Oficinas de ASDIR ya que eschucho por una emisos que se da credito y la cual ell necesita que se le apoye con un credito que le permitira surtir su tienda, manifiesta que comprar por mayor el precio es menos y con los ingreso le permite ingrementar sus ganancias y poder mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Estela is originally from the Patzarajmac community. For several years, she was living in Guatemala City where she worked as a bartender. Five years ago, she started her own business selling daily household products in her community.

Maria Estela visited the offices of ASDIR to explain why a loan should be issued to her. She needs help with restocking the inventory of her store. She plans to buy products wholesale so that she can get the lowest price. The profit will increase her income and improve the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Franklin Arligton

texts.es: El Señor Franklin Méndez Gaítan de 27 años vive en el Reparto Los Cedros Km. 28 Carretera vieja león, tiene un hijo de tres años de edad al cual quiere ofrecerlo las mejores condiciones de vida y en un futuro. Profesión Ingeniero Civil. El trabaja para la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de Asistente de Dirección obras publicas anteriormente trabaja en comercio navieros nicaragüense. Los planes a corto plazo es construir un cuarto para su hijo. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo desembolsado siendo utilizado para compra de materiales como: cemento, hierro, perlines y otros,  Obteniendo como beneficio la seguridad y protección para su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin Méndez Gaítan is 27, and he lives in the Reparto Los Cedros Km. 28 Carretera Vieja León. He has a three year old son, and he wants to provide him with the best living conditions now and in the future. He is a civil engineer. He works in the mayor’s office in Villa del Carmen. He is the Assistant Director of Public Works. He previously worked in the Nicaraguan shipping business. His short-term plan is to build a room for his son. He is grateful to the Institution for the loan given to him. It is being used to buy materials like cement, iron, beams, and others. The benefit will be safety and protection for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es: Ana del Socorro C. M. tiene la edad de 52 años. Ana no logro finalizar sus estudios académicos, pero esto no le impidió conseguir un medio de vida para salir adelante, con los 2 hijos que tiene a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven  ya que tenía que buscar la manera de generar ingresos para su familia, y poco a poco adquirió experiencia en esta actividad y le gusto mucho el relacionarse con sus clientes y saber lo que necesitaban. Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar pinturas de unas, estuches de pinturas de labios, ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Su mayor sueño es establecer un negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana del Socorro C. M. is 52 years old and the mother of two children for whom she cares. She couldn't finish her academic studies, but this didn't prevent her from getting ahead in life.

Ana has a store offering general merchandise. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years. She started at a very young age since she needed an income for her family. Gradually she gained experience in her trade. She loves socializing with her customers and getting to know their needs.

Ana will use her loan to buy make-up and lipsticks as well as clothes for children, ladies and gentlemen. Her biggest dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patricia  Hidalia

texts.es: La Señora Patricia R. tiene 35 años de edad, habitante de Samaria una comarca de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen casada, su esposo es operador de maquinaria, le ayuda económicamente tiene cinco hijos todos mayores, los planes que tiene es mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de Directora del medio ambiente, desde hace seis meses y anteriormente en proyectos del mined. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo con el cual realizara mejoras a la vivienda en los cuartos y un pequeño anexo comprando materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, zinc y ladrillos.  El cual alcanzara una mayor seguridad y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia R. is 35 years old and a resident of Samaria, an area of the Villa del Carmen community. Her husband is a machine operator. He helps her economically. She has five children, all of whom are older. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house. For six months, she has worked in Villa del Carmen's town hall in the role of Envrionmental Director, and before that on mining projects. She is thankful to the Institution for the loan with which she will complete improvements to the rooms in her house and a small annex by purchasing construction materials such as cement, beams, zinc, and bricks. This will achieve greater security and comfort for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand rooms.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes S. Blandón tiene 63 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de ella.
