La actividad económica de Mercedes es una panadería en donde realiza la elaboración de pasteles. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Desde muy joven le gustaba el trabajo. Por lo que siente muy orgullosa por desempeñar esta actividad tan humilde y que le ha proporcionado todo lo necesario como el pan de cada día, ya que fue con este negocio que logro ofrecerles a sus hijos alimento, calzado ropa y estudio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, leña, harina, mantequilla, queso, huevos y gastos de luz y agua. El sueño de Mercedes es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes S. Blandón is 63 years old. She is a single woman. She has four children in her care who still depend on her. Mercedes' economic activity is a bakery where she makes cakes. She has been dedicated to this job for more than 15 years. She has liked working since she was young. So, she feels very proud to work in a humble role that provides everything that is necessary such as daily bread since it was with this business that she was able to offer her children food, clothing and education. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase sugar, firewood, flour, butter, cheese, eggs and pay the water and electricity bills. Mercedes' dream is to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es: La Señorita Maria A. de 21 años de edad, soltera, vive en el apante comarca de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen con sus abuelitos. Como planes la seguridad y protección de sus seres querido es esencial. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen como auxiliar de contabilidad desde hace dos años, de profesión de contaduría. Las dificultades que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento. Con el préstamo que realizo en Afodenic Comprara materiales de construcción  como. Cemento, ladrillo, un pantry para su cocina para estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria A. is 21 years old, is single and lives in Apante located in the community of Villa del Carmen with her grandparents. Plans for security and protection of her loved onces is essential. For two years, she has worked in the Villa del Carmen town hall as an accounting assistant. The difficulties that she is facing is the lack of financing. With the loan that Afodenic has provided, she will purchase construction materials such a cement, bricks, and a pantry for her kitchen so that it can be in better condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pantry for her kitchen and construction materials to install it.

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es: Santos Victoria Z. Z. tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo. Y es madre de 2 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Debido a la necesidad de aportar cierto ingreso para su familia,  y motivada por su familia decide emprender su negocio que es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, en donde sus clientes recurren a su vivienda para comprar la carne del cerdo. Uno de los desafíos que enfrento es que debido a su edad no puede caminar a lugares tan lejanos por lo que solo buscando en ciertas comarcas es donde encuentra más favorable a los cerdos. El destino del financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y ciertos utensilios. Su deseo es seguir luchando con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santos Victoria Z. Z. is 65 years old and lives with her husband. She is also mother to two children who still depend on them. Due to the necessity to provide certain income for her family, and motivated by her family, she decided to start a business butchering pigs. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than four years whereby her customers come to her house to purchase pork. One of the challenges that she has faced is, due to her age, she cannot walk to faraway places so she is looking only in certain places where it is more favorable for the pigs. The loan will be used as working capital for the purchase of pigs and certain utenstils. Her desire is to continue moving forward with her business so that her children have the opportunity to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: El Nuevo Amanecer De Ventanilla Group

texts.es:
ALCOM EL NUEVO AMANECER D. VENTANILLA


Rosa S. D. 55 años vive en la zona 13 lt 498 pque.porcino ventanilla-los olivos lima Perú, ella esta casada con el Sr. Florencio ambos  tienen  3 hijos.
Ellos  se dedican a la crianza y venta D. cerdos  hace 18 años, la Sra. Rosa forma parte del grupo EL NUEVO AMANECER D. VENTANILLA conformado por 10 personas, ella forma parte del grupo desD. hace  1 año y fue invitada por medio D. la Municipalidad D. Ventanilla ya q ella forma parte del comedor  donD. se reúnen cada mes.
La Sra. Rosa empezó con este negocio ya que su padre fue el fundador D. la zona y se dedicaba a la crianza D. cerdos, viendo esto ella deciD. criar por su cuenta para D. esta manera ayudar a su esposo, quien es albañil, con la educación D. sus hijos.
Juntos han logrado mejorar su granja ellos empezaron con una chanchita y ahora tienen un aproximado D. 70 cerdos incluyendo sus crías además D. patos, gallinas y un huerto frutal actualmente con mucho esfuerzo se han comprado un mototaxi para poder ayudar a su hijo, con  el préstamo que les otorga EDAPROSPO desean incrementar la crianza D. su ganado ya que su meta es llegar a exportar,su esposo Florencio a quien ella llama con cariño “mi viejito” le ayuda cada mañana a limpiar los corrales D. los animales ellos saben que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio  lograran cosas importantes en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa S. is 55 years old and lives in the district of 13 LT 498 Pque. Porcino Ventanilla-Los Olivos, in Lima, Peru. She is married to Sr. Florencio and they have three children. “El Nuevo Amancecer D. Ventanilla” is comprised of 10 members. Sra. Rosa formed part of the group a year ago and it later merged with another group from the city of Ventanilla, where they meet at a dining hall each month. Rosa started this business because her father was the founder of the district and was devoted to raising pigs. She saw that she needed to earn her own income as a way of supporting her husband, who is a mason, with the education of their children. Together they have succeeded in improving their pig farm and now have approximately 70 pigs. They also raise ducks and chickens, as well as maintain a fruit orchard. Through much effort, they were able to buy a motortaxi for their son. With the loan from EDAPROSPO, they want to increase the number of pigs because their goal is to begin exporting meat. She affectionately calls her husband Florencio “my old man” because he helps her every morning by cleaning the animal pens. They know that with much effort and sacrifice, they can achieve great things in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Perla Leonor

texts.es: La Señora Perla Méndez tiene 35 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Villa del Carmen del municipio de Managua, Soltera con tres hijos de 19,16 y 8 años de edad. Madre emprendedora que en primer estancias esta la mejora de su condiciones de vida para sus hijos. Trabaja en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de secretaria de registro público desde hace 6 meses anteriormente trabaja en una farmacia como despachadora. Con dificultades  pero ha logrado ir construyendo su vivienda poco a poco le falta unos de lo cuarto, el cual gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara: bloque, cemento, perlines y arena construyendo un cuarto seguro.
texts.en:
Perla Méndez is 35 years old and a resident of Villa del Carmen in the municipality of Managua. She is single with three children who are 19,16 and 8 years of age. She is a hard-working mother whose primary goal is to improve her children's living conditions. For six months, she has worked in the Villa del Carmen town hall in the role of Public Registry Secretary. Previously, she worked in a pharmacy as a dispatcher. Despite difficulties, she has been building her house gradually but lacks a room. Thanks to the Afodenic loan, she will purchase cement, beams and sand to build a safe room.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis H. G. tiene 72 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Que están al cuido de su esposa. Luis tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, es por eso que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. El un hombre muy preocupado y responsable con sus hijos. Pues todos los días recorre muchos lugares, para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y calzado. Su deseo es obtener su establecimiento y acondicionarlo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Luis H. G. is 72 years of age and has three children he is responsible for and who are under the care of his wife. Luis's business is general merchandise and he's been engaged in this activity for more than six years. He does his selling door-to-door and on the streets, so that's why he gets up very early every day to offer his products and put food on the table every day for his family. He is very concerned and responsible with his children. So every day he travels all over the place so that his children will have the opportunity to study. The reason he is seeking this loan is for working capital for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, purses and footwear. His goal is to get himself a store and fix it up nicely.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es: Doña Rosa es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan  su princiapl fuente de trabajo es la venta y elaboracion de cortes tipicos y blusa, ella tiene su pequeño taller con tres operarias y que su producto los vende en las plazas, en Chimaltenango, Salcaja y Totonicapan ella necesita un credito para surtir su mercaderia ya que se acercan algunas fiestas de algunos municipio y aprovechar las ventas para poder desarrollarse y creser economicamente para el bienestar se su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is originally from the Totonicapan District. Her main line of work involves manufacturing and selling traditional wraps and blouses. She has a small workshop with three workers. Her products are sold at the markets in Chimaltenango, Salcaja and Totonicapan.

Doña Rosa needs a loan to increase her inventory. There are a few holidays approaching, so she needs to take advantage of this opportunity to generate more sales. This will help her develop and grow financially for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Jesús Eduardo

texts.es: El joven Jesús Eduardo con reidencia en la comunidad de Chotacaj a cuatro kilometos de la ciudad de Totonicapán el desde ñiño aprendio la actividad del comercio ya desde esa edad acompañaba a su querido padre para la ventas en diferentes lugares, en plazas y fiestas atravez de los tiempos el deside hacer su propio negocio, que hasta la fecha todo le esta saliendo bien el fisita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para ampliar su capital, para surtir su mercaderia y poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, en las diferentes comunidades del altiplano.
texts.en:
Jesús Eduardo is a young man living in the community of Chotacaj, located four kilometers from the city of Totonicapán. Since he was a boy, he learned about conducting business by accompanying his father to sell at different places, such as markets and festivals. After some time, he decided to go into business for himself and is doing well so far.

Jesús Eduardo came to ASDIR seeking a loan to increase his capital. He needs to restock with more merchandise so that he can fulfill the needs of his clients who live in the various communities of the Altiplano (High Plains).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: El señor José O., tiene 29 años de edad, habitante del municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, casado, su esposa trabaja como comerciante, no tiene hijos, en el negocio tiene variedad de productos como: ropas, bisutería, productos de plástico y de grano básico. Los planes a corto plazo es generar mayores utilidades con la producción como: maíz y trigo, pero en el camino del desarrollo de este plan ha encontrado como principal dificulta la falta de financiamiento económico. Gracias  a la Institución lograra comprar semillas de maíz, trigo y productos  de abarrote. Permitiendo ofrecer a su familia mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
José O. is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Villa del Carmen in the region of Managua. He is married- his wife works as a vendor- and he does not have any children.
His business offers a variety of products like clothing, jewellery, plastic products and staple grains. The short term plan is to generate greater profits through the production of corn and wheat. His main difficulty in developing this plan has been the lack of financing.
Thanks to AFODENIC he will be able to purchase corn and wheat seeds, and groceries, allowing him to better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow corn

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: El señor Héctor David Chávez tiene  59 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene tres hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. El señor Chávez es dueño de una tienda de productos varios ubicada frente a la policía, en la cual ofrece venta de ropa, recargas electrónicas, cabinas telefónicas, servicio de fotocopiadora y además vende calzado. Don Héctor Chávez comenzó su negocio de ventas varias hace ya cuatro años y estaba ubicado el negocio en su casa. Ahora lo traslado hacia frente a la policía con el objetivo de tener un lugar más estratégico de ventas, para  vender más. El crédito será invertido en la compra de más mercancías productos variados, principalmente ropa, calzado y artículos escolares. Su sueño es tener una librería bien surtida para brindarle a su familia lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Mr. Hector David C. is 59 years old, married, and has three children, who are all adults now. Mr. C. is he owner of a general store located in front of a police station, where he sells clothing, electronics, offers phone booths, photocopy service, and also sells shoes. Mr. Hector C. began his sales business four years ago from his home. Now he has moved it to a location in front of the police station with the objective of having a more strategic location for sales in order to sell more. The loan will be invested in the purchase of more general merchandise, principally clothing, shoes, and school supplies. His dream is to have a well supplied bookstore so he can provide all that is necessary for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sara Sebastiana

texts.es: Doña Sara es originaria de la comunidad de patzarajmac del municipio de Totonicapan desde cuando ella tenia catorce años aprendio ha coser a maquina como operaria cuando ella cumplio veinte años  decidio iniciar su propio negocio  y compro una su maquina, con trabajos pequeños, luego compra otra maquina porque consigue a otra persona, para bordados hasta la fecha realiza un sin fin de costuras, hoy necesita de un credito para otra trabajador la cual necesita incrementar su produccion y  mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Sara is from Patzarajmac in the municipality of Totonicapán. At the age of 14 she learned to operate a sewing machine. When she was 20, she decided to start her own business, bought a sewing machine and carried out small orders. Later on she bought another machine to make embroideries. So far she made a great many sewing jobs. Today she needs a loan to hire another worker and increase her production. Sara hopes to better the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Martina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Martina de la Concepcion N. C. tiene 52 años. Hace más de 38 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar los servicios de costura. Martina dio inicio por una amiga que la apoyo con la idea, de elaborar prendas de vestir, a pesar de la difícil situación que Martina enfrento por ser madre y padre de sus 4 hijos, es una mujer que ha experimentado que el cuido de sus hijos y mantener su negocio, a pesar de esto logro ofrecerles a sus hijos el sustento diario. Martina necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo como telas, hilos, tijeras, alfileres entre otras cosas. El sueño de Martina es que establecer un taller adecuado para confeccionar sus prendas y que se puedan exhibir en otros países.
texts.en:
Martina de la Concepcion N. C. is 52 years old. More than 38 years ago she began her business. Her work is to provide her services as a tailor. Martina started her work with the help of a friend who supported her idea to make clothing. Despite her difficult situation being both mother and father to her four children, she is a woman who has experienced that the care of her children and successfully running a business, despite the challenges, offers her and her children with daily sustenance. Martina needs a loan for business capital such as fabric, string, sewing needles, and pins among other things. Martina's dream is to establish a proper workshop in which to make her clothing and that she can show her work in other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Michel Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Michel E. de 24 años de edad, soltero, habitante de la comarca  Monte Fresco, Municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, le ayuda a su madre en los gastos de su casa. Como planes que tiene es mejorar su vivienda para ofrecerle una mayor comodidad a su madre. Se desempeña como auxiliar de bodega en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses anteriormente trabajaba en Managua como obrero de construcción, lo que significa que tiene suficiente conocimiento en lo que es construcción. Gracias a Afodenic lograra comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y zinc para construir una pared y poder estar terne una casa segura y digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Michel E. is 24 years old and single. He lives in the region of Monte Fresco in the city of Villa del Carmen, district of Managua. He helps his mother with the household expenses. He plans to make improvements to his house so that his mother can live more comfortably. Previously, he worked as an assistant at a grocery store in Villa del Carmen. He now works as a construction worker in Managua, which he has been doing for 6 months. His current job has given him enough knowledge to do his own home projects.

Thanks to AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, and zinc to build a wall that will give him a secure and decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a security wall

loans.name: Luis Simeon

texts.es: Luis Semeon L. tiene 43 años. Es un hombre soltero. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de él. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a su negocio, por lo que su empeño en salir adelante fue lo que motivo a Luis a establecer este negocio. El dinero que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, frutas, verduras, carnes. Su mayor sueño es aumentar su producción para el día de mañana poseer su propio comedor.
texts.en:
Luis Semeon L. is 43 years of age and is a single man. He has two children under his care who are still dependent on him. His business is a grocery store and he's been engaged in this for more than four years. His determination to get ahead was the motive which led him to establish this business. The money he is seeking is for working capital for the purchase of basic grains, fruits, vegetables and meats. His greatest dream is to build up his business so that some day he can have his own canteen.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Agustina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Agustina de la Concepción Pérez es cliente de Fundación León 2000, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de ella. El espíritu emprendedor y trabajador de Agustina es lo mejor para ella, pues fue por medio de esas fuerzas que el motivo para  establecer la actividad económica como es bar y comedor. Hace más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, su negocio está ubicado en el sector de las peñitas, por lo que ofrece muy buena comida y ambiente acogedor. Por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en la atención al cliente. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, gaseosas, jugos y refrescos naturales. Por lo que el sueño de Agustina es brindarle a su familia las condiciones adecuadas de vida.
texts.en:
Agustina de la Concepción Pérez is a client of Fundación León 2000. She is married and has 3 dependent children. Agustina's hardworking, entrepreneurial spirt has helped her most; it was these strengths that motivated her to start her bar and diner. It has been more than 25 years since she dedicated herself to this business. It is located in the Las Peñitas sector, and offers good food and a welcoming atmosphere. Her children help her attend to her customers. Her motive for seeking financing is to have work capital for the purchase of staple grains, vegetables, meat, soda, juice and fresh-squeezed fruit juice. Agustina's dream is to provide her family with a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Raquel Francisca

texts.es: Raquel Francisca O. M. tiene 29 años. A pesar de su corta edad Raquel es una joven muy luchadora cada día se levanta, muy temprano para encargarse de sus 2 hijos. Y además de cuidar a sus hijos tiene que hacerse cargo de su negocio. Raquel inicio este negocio por su Papa por que anteriormente él era el dueño, pero dada las circunstancias de la vida, su Papa falleció entregándole únicamente este humilde negocio, para que ella se hiciera cargo. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrenta ya que no tiene ayuda para la elaboración del pan. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como azúcar, harina, huevos y mantenimiento del horno. Su mayor sueño es que su negocio sea mucho mas estable.
texts.en:
Raquel Francisca O. M. is 29 years old. In spite of her young age, Raquel is a fighter. She gets up very early every day to take care of her two children. And, in addition to taking care of her children she has to take care of her business. Raquel started working in this business because her father used to own it, but due to life circumstances, her father passed on. He left her only this humble business which she now takes care of, in spite of the difficulties she faces, since she does not have help making bread.

She is applying for this loan for capital to use to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, and eggs, and for the upkeep of her oven. Her greatest dream is that her business be much more stable.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José E. M. tiene 34 años. Desde hace 17 años vende comida en su humilde vivienda. Prepara ciertas comidas rápidas como enchiladas, huevos, gallo pinto, queso frito. Con este negocio ha logrado salir adelante pues es una persona que lucha por sus intereses. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos y además se encuentra activo por lo que tiene que realizar la elaboración de la comida. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, leña, plátano, yuca entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes siempre se encuentren satisfechos.
texts.en:
Silvio José E. M. is 34 years old. For the past 17 years he has sold food in his humble home. He prepares some fast foods like enchiladas, eggs, gallo pinto (a Nicaraguan rice and bean dish), and fried cheese. He has been able to succeed in this business because he is a person who fights for his interests.

What he enjoys about his business is that his customers are satisfied, and he can be active because he has to prepare the food. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, wood, bananas, yucca, and other things. His greatest dream is to improve the quality of his products so that his customers will always be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 32 años, es una madre muy alegre y comprensiva, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres junto a sus 3 hijos: Bladimir de 9, Yanira de 7 y Mery de 6 de años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El trabajo de Beatriz es la venta de pescado, tiene su puesto en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y bromear entre ellas, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que este se le pega en la ropa y prácticamente tiene que soportarlo todo el día. Para el futuro espera tener un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender sus pescados sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este es el quinto préstamo de Beatriz con MFP, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar su congeladora, ya que con el paso de los años ha ido fallando y con el dinero que sobre comprará más pescado para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 32 years old. She is a cheerful and understanding mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents together with her three children: Bladimir, 9; Yanira, 7; and Mery, 6. She wishes to give her children a good life.

Beatriz’s work is the sale of fish. She has a stand in the Cerro Colorado Market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her stand is very crowded with her customers since she sells the freshest and tastiest fish in the market and is a very cheerful saleswoman who always has a smile for her customers.

What she likes most about her work is conversing and joking with her neighbors in the market. She has been in this business for 12 years, and the most difficult thing is enduring the intense odor of the fish, since this sticks to her clothes and she has to bear it all day. For the future, she hopes to have a small refrigerator where she can sell her fish without fear that it will spoil from the heat of the sun.

This is Beatriz’s fifth loan with MFP. She feels very happy about the opportunity of obtaining credit and hopes to make all her payments on time. She is a very dear member of her community bank because of the joy she puts into the group. With the 2000 new soles she is applying for she will make repairs to her deep-freezer since with the passage of the years it has broken down. With money that is left over she will buy more fish in order to have more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of her deep-freezer

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 25 años, es una joven muy entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hermana Maximiliana de 35 años, quien le ayuda en los negocios que realiza. A más de 5000 mil m.s.n.m. se encuentra la mina La Rinconada, la cual está ubicada en Ananea (Distrito de Juliaca), es aquí donde Eusebia tiene su negocio de venta de muñecos de peluche, el cual es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los enamorados que buscan regalar algo bonito a sus parejas, los muñecos que comercializa los trae desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero, las cuales por ser fronterizas, ofrecen una variedad más amplia. Eusebia es muy feliz cuando se entera que uno de sus muñecos fue bien recibido por la persona a quien se lo regalaron, ya que el pueblo donde trabaja es muy pequeño y se entera fácilmente de lo que sucede. Lleva 4 años en este negocio y cree que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso frió que hace en la mina, que muchas veces la enferma y no la deja trabajar con normalidad. Para un futuro cercano, anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Eusebia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no causar problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por los ánimos que le pone al trabajo en grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muñecos de peluche para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Eusebia, aged 25, is a very enthusiastic and hard-working young lady. She lives in a rented room with her sister Maximiliana, aged 35, who helps her in her business.

The La Rinconada mine, which is located in Ananea (district of Juliaca), is situated at over 5000 meters (16400 feet) above sea level. It is here that Eusebia owns a soft toys store. It is a very popular store, especially with lovers who look for a nice present to their sweetheart. Eusebia buys her toys in Tacna and Desaguadero, which are border cities and offer a wider range of products. She is very happy when she finds out that one of her soft toys was gladly received by the loved one, which she easily gets to know since her village is very small. She has been running this store for four years and the hardest is to endure the intense cold in the mine which often makes her sick and prevents her from working normally. Her greatest wish for the near future is to have a larger store in which she can provide a better service to her customers.

This is Eusebia’s fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she must pay her installments in time and not cause problems to the members of her community bank who love her team spirit. Eusebia will use her 2000 nuevos soles to buy more soft toys and increase the inventory in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es: Graciana tiene 43 años, es una persona muy alegre y carismática, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos; Yhon de 23 y Rodrigo de 21 años, a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro. El negocio de Graciana está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), se dedica a la venta de carne, la cual trae desde zonas ganaderas. Su puesto es muy concurrido y casi siempre es una de las primeras en acabar con la carne que tiene a la venta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 8 años en esta actividad y cree que lo más difícil es transportar la carne, ya que son muchos kilos los que trae y el peso siempre la cansa en demasía, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una carnicería más grande, donde pueda vender sin miedo a que su mercadería se malogre. Este es el tercer préstamo de Graciana con MFP y está decidida a pagar todas sus cuotas sin demoras, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne para vender, con lo cual espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Graciana is 43 years old; she is a very happy and charismatic person. She lives in her own house with her two children: Yhon is 23 and Rodrigo is 21. She hopes to provide them with a good future. Graciana's business is located in the Cerro Colorado market (an important market in Juliaca city). She sells meat, which is brought from regions that specialize in livestock production. Her stand is very popular and almost always is one of the first to sell out. What she likes most about her work is chatting with the neighboring vendors. Graciana has been doing this work for 8 years and for her the most difficult part is transporting the meat, as it weighs many kilos and transporting it is incredibly tiring. However, she knows that this is part of her work and she has to do it. In the near future she hopes to have a bigger butcher's shop, where she can sell without fear of her meat products spoiling. This is Graciana's third loan with MFP and she is committed to making her repayments on time. In her community bank, she is a very active member and is always aware of the agreements the members have made as a group. With the requested 1,000 PEN she will buy more meat to sell, which she hopes will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela D. 54 años, es vecina muy querida en su barrio, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es tener una vejez digna. La venta D. papa es su actividad diaria, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido debido a la buena ubicación que tiene, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre convence a sus clientes D. llevarse algo a casa. Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta y hacer D. esta manera más amenas las largas horas D. trabajo, lleva 28 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para un futuro cercano anhela tener una tienda más granD. donD. pueda vender papas y otros productos. Este es el sexto préstamo D. Marcela con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más papa para incrementar la cantidad que tiene actualmente en venta.
texts.en:
Marcela, 54, is a beloved neighbor in her neighborhood. She lives in her own house. What she wants most is to have a decent old age. She sells potatoes every day. Her stand is located in the Cerro Colorado market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). It is very busy because of its good location. She is a charismatic sales person. She always convinces her customers to take something home. What she likes best about her business is talking with her neighboring sales people. That makes the long working hours more amenable. She has been doing this for 28 years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her stand all day. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the near future her goal is to have a larger store where she could sell potatoes and other products. This is Marcela’s sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She wants to have access to other loans in the future. She is a well liked member of her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy more potatoes in order to increase the current amount she now has for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres, junto a su esposo Moisés de 38 años y gracias a su duro trabajo sus hijos ya son independientes y lo que ahora anhela es vivir una vejez tranquila. En Ananea (distrito de Juliaca) se encuentra el negocio de María, el cual es muy concurrido por las personas, debido a la variedad de artículos que ofrece; vende juguetes, cartucheras, porta CDs, etc., lo cual ha hecho que su tienda sea una de las más completas del pueblo. Ella consigue la mercadería de las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero donde hay mayor variedad y bajos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que es su propia jefa y que puede tomar las decisiones que mejor le parezcan, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frio que hace en Ananea. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda más completa donde pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es el primer préstamo de María con MFP y está muy contenta por la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para llevar a vender en Ananea, espera así poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a hard working mother. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She lives with her husband, Moisés, who is 38. Thanks to her hard work, all of her children are now independent. What she wishes for now is to have a tranquil old age. María’s business is in Ananea (a district in Juliaca). It is very busy because of the variety of articles that she sells. She sells toys, pencil cases, and CD carriers, etc. This has made her store one of the most complete in the town. She gets the merchandise from cities like Tacna and Desaguadero, where there are better varieties and lower prices. What she likes best about her work is that she is her own boss, and she can make the decisions that seem the best to her. She has had her business for five years. The most difficult part is putting up with the intense cold in Ananea. In the near future she hopes to have a more complete store where she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This is María’s first loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity to receive a loan. She is a very responsible member of her community bank, and she is always aware of the agreements made by the members. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products to take to Ananea to sell. She expects that she will be able to increase her income this way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 25 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de unos familiares y tiene mucho deseo de salir adelante. Para ella, el negocio de fabricar muebles es una actividad muy rentable, desde muy niña siempre le gusto trabajar con la madera, ya que su padre tenía una carpintería y ahora ella que tiene la suya propia se siente muy feliz. Marleny trabaja junto a sus hermanos, quienes también decidieron dedicarse a la carpintería. Ella disfruta de manejar las maquinarias y de darle su toque femenino a los muebles acabados, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cortar las maderas, ya que siempre hay peligro de que suceda algún percance. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una carpintería más grande donde pueda trabajar profesionalmente. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Marleny con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más madera para fabricar nuevos muebles y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marleny, 25, is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her relatives’ house, and she has a great desire to get ahead. The business of making furniture is very profitable for her. Since she was a very young girl, she has always liked to work with wood. Her father had a carpentry shop, and now that she has her own she feels very happy. Marleny works together with her siblings, who also decided to do carpentry work. She enjoys working the machines and giving her feminine touch to the furniture’s finishing details. She has been in this business for ten years. The most difficult thing about her work is cutting the wood, because there is always the danger of an accident. In the near future she hopes to have a larger carpentry shop where she can work professionally. This is Marleny’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to pay it on time, and she is prepared to do so. She wants to access future loans. She is very happy in her community bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wood to make new furniture and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida en su barrio, a sus 35 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Marcial de 37 años y sus 4 hijos: Yara de 15, Pilar de 14, Fridman de 11 y Zulla de 9 años, ella ha luchado mucho para salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Maximiliana es la administradora de uno de los restaurantes más concurridos de la comunidad donde está  la mina La Rinconada en Ananea (distrito de Juliaca), tiene menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, sus clientes salen muy contentos y satisfechos. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus comensales, ya que siempre los atiende muy rápido, en los 8 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar bajo la presión de sus clientes y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos lo que comen en su restaurante. Para el futuro espera tener un restaurante con ambientes adecuados, donde sus clientes se sientan más cómodos. Maximiliana se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los mil nuevos solicitados comprará nuevas mesas y sillas para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a hardworking woman who is much beloved in her neighborhood. She is 35 years old and lives in a rented house with her 37 year old husband Marcial and their 4 children: Yara - 15, Pilar - 14, Fridman – 11, and Sulla – 9. She has fought hard to get ahead and improve their lives. Maximiliana manages one of the most popular restaurants in the community near the Rinconada Ananea Mine (in the Juliaca district). She offers an assorted menu of delicious foods, and her customers leave very happy and satisfied. What she enjoys most about her business is attending to her customers, whom she tries to respond to each one fairly quickly. In the 8 years she has been operating, she has learned to work under the pressure from her customers. This is the hardest part of her business, but she always tries to satisfy everyone who comes to her restaurant. In the future, she would like to provide a suitable environment where her customers feel more comfortable.

Maximiliana is on her seventh loan with MFP and knows she has to make her payments on time. Her communal bank is a very happy group and all the members get along with one another. With her loan of 1000 soles, she plans to purchase new tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 22 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de muebles, los cuales adquiere de la carpintería de su madre y son muy solicitados por los clientes, ya que son de muy buen material. Ya lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos sobre el mueble que más le servirá, pero considera que lo más difícil es transportar los muebles desde la carpintería. Nelly sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesta a hacerlo con tal de mejorar su vida. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus muebles con mucha más comodidad, ya que actualmente lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nelly con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muebles para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Nelly is 22 years old and a hardworking young woman. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents and what she wants most is to get ahead. Nelly sells furniture she acquires from her mother’s carpentry workshop. These pieces are in high demand because they are made of very good material. She has been selling furniture for 15 years. What she likes most about her job is talking with clients and advising them on which pieces of furniture are most suitable for them. Her biggest challenge is transporting the furniture from the workshop. Nelly knows she has to work hard to achieve her goals and is willing to do so in order to improve her life. In the future, she hopes to have a shop where she can sell her furniture more comfortably because she currently travels to meet her clients.

This is Nelly’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows she has to pay on time because she does not want to create problems for her communal bank. Nelly is one of the most beloved and admired members of her group. With her loan of 2000 soles, she plans to buy more furniture to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Nolverta

texts.es: Nolverta es una mujer que a sus 39 años siempre ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 hijos: Wilfredo de 21, Wilber de 20, Yeni de 18, Cintia de 16 y Álvaro de 13 años, quienes son la razón de todos sus esfuerzos. Para comer bien en Juliaca, se tiene que visitar el restaurante de Nolverta, el cual se ha convertido en uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad, debido a la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.  A ella le gusta cocinar y siempre lo hace con mucha dedicación, pero le disgusta mucho servir y alcázar los platos de comida a los clientes, porque tiene que hacerlo sola, ya que no cuenta con el dinero para pagarle a un ayudante, aun así no se desanima y quiere salir adelante para en el futuro llevar una mejor vida. Nolverta ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y ha decidido que quiere ampliarlo incrementando el número de mesas que actualmente tiene. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde siempre paga todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Sus deseos de progreso son respaldos por sus compañeros de banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida y ella trabaja también por el bien de los demás. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mesas y sillas, así podrá atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Nolverta is 39 years old. She has always fought hard to get ahead. Nolverta lives in her own home with her 5 children: Wilfredo - 21, Wilber - 20, Yeni -18, Cynthia – 16, and Alvaro -13. Her kids are the reason for all her efforts.

If you want to eat well in Juliaca, then you must visit Nolverta’s restaurant. It is one of the most popular in town because the food is so flavorful. She enjoys cooking and will continue to do so with great dedication. However, she dislikes serving and keeping up with customers’ orders because she runs her business by herself and does not have enough money to pay an assistant. She has yet to become frustrated and wants to get ahead in order to have a better life. Nolverta has been in business for 5 years and has decided to expand by increasing the number of tables she already has.

This is her second loan with MFP and she always makes her payments on time. Her desire to succeed is supported by her fellow community bank members. She is well admired and also works for the good of others. With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more tables and chairs so that she can serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años, desde muy joven se preocupó por salir adelante en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio son los metales, en su taller los moldea y los convierte en diversas estructuras, como carretillas, escritorios, sillas, etc, también aprovecha para arreglar cosas malogradas, lo que le genera un ingreso extra. Actualmente trabaja con un ayudante, quien realiza todos los trabajos de mayor esfuerzo físico. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar las cosas malogradas que le traen, ya que aunque es mujer arregla muy bien los artefactos, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que conseguir los metales para moldear, ya que transportarlos le resulta muy pesado y cansado. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en uno de los principales de la ciudad. Este es el tercer préstamo de Simona con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los demás. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para la fabricación de estructuras metálicas y el arreglo de artefactos malogrados.
texts.en:
Simona is 50-years-old, and since she was very young, she has been concerned with getting ahead in life. She lives in her own house, and what she wants the most is to improve her quality of life. She has a business doing metal work. In her workshop, she molds the metal and coverts it into diverse forms like wheelbarrows, desks, chairs, etc. She also repairs broken things to generate extra income. She currently works with an assistant, who does the work that requires more physical effort. What she likes the most about her job is fixing broken things that people bring her because she fixes them very well even though she is a woman. She has done this work for 15 years, and the thing that she likes the least is having to obtain metals to mold because transporting them is hard and tiring. This is Simona's third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and just like with her other loans, she is willing to make all of her payments on time. She is very loved in her communal bank because she always worries about others' well-being. With this loan of 2,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy new materials to make metal items and to fix broken items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her workshop.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: Vicentina es una mujer muy trabajadora, desD. muy joven ha luchado por forjarse una buena vida y hoy a sus 50 años todavía lo sigue haciendo. Ella vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su familia y lo que más quiere es tener una vejez tranquila. Se dedica a la venta D. muebles en una plaza D. su ciudad, venD. D. manera ambulatoria a las personas que transitan por este lugar, a quienes atienD. con mucha paciencia y cariño, ya que lo que más le gusta es ver su rostro D. felicidad cuando compran el mueble D. su agrado. Son ya 15 años lo que Vicentina lleva en este negocio y se siente muy feliz realizándolo, aunque sufre mucho cada ves que llueve y tiene que apresurarse a guardar los muebles. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda donD. pueda vender sus muebles con mayor tranquilidad y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el primer préstamo D. Vicentina con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y desea hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa, siempre está al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muebles para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad D. dónD. escoger.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a very hard-working woman. Since she was very young, she has fought to create a good life for herself. Now, at 50-years-old, she keeps doing it. She lives in a rented house with her family, and what she wants the most is to have a peaceful old age. She sells furniture in a plaza in her city. She works as a street vendor and sells to the people who travel through this area. She attends to them with a lot of care and patience. What she likes the most is seeing the happy faces when people buy furniture that they like. She has had this business for 15 years and is very happy with it. It is hard every time it rains because she has to hurry to cover all of her furniture. In the future she wants to have a store where she can sell her furniture more calmly and improve her income. This is the first loan that Vicentina has had with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she wants to do this. She is an active participant in her communal bank. She is always up to date with the agreements that are maD. at the meetings. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more furniture so she can offer her customers more variety from which to choose.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es una joven de 22 años muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Rodolfo de 20 años y su Hija Jennifer de 5 años, a quien desea brindar un buen futuro. Su negocio se encuentra en Ananea (distrito de Juliaca), tiene una tienda donde vende muñecos de peluche, los cuales consigue en el mercado San José (mercado de Juliaca), su negocio es muy concurrido y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa amistosa. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y los aconseja sobre cual es el muñeco más bonito para que se lo lleven, tiene 2 años con este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada. Ella considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es soportar el intenso frió que hace en Ananea, ya que está muy cerca de la cordillera. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor tranquilidad a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muñecos de peluche para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Yeny is a very happy 22-year-old woman. She lives in her parents' house along with her husband, Rodolfo, who is 20. Her daughter Jennifer is 5-years-old, and Yeny wants to give her a good future. Her business is located in Ananea (in the district of Juliaca). She sells stuffed animals, which she obtains in the San José market in Juliaca. Her business is very frequented and she always greets her customers with a friendly smile. She enjoys chatting with her customers and advising them about the loveliest stuffed animal to buy. She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well for her, but she still doesn't feel accomplished. She thinks the most difficult part of her job is tolerating the intense cold in Ananea since it is very close to the mountains. In the near future, she wants to have a bigger store where she can attend to her clients more peacefully. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she knows that she has to meet her payments and she hopes to be able to do this. She also doesn't want to cause any problems for her communal bank, where she has been well-received. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more stuffed animals to increase the quantity of merchandise she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 40, widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a food stall. Her income comes primarily from selling seafood products such as dried fish in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Niño Nativo Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Niño Nativo, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad D. Acoria, la cual pertenece al departamento D. Huancavelica. Es el Distrito más antiguo D. la provincia.

María es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella, inicio su negocio vendiendo jugos y bebidas D. todo tipo; con los créditos que recibe poco a poco fue incrementando su mercadería hasta llegar a tener una pequeña bodega donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad e inclusive a brindar servicio D. fotocopiado ya que a podido comprar una maquina fotocopiadora. Ella, se encuentra ahorrando para comprar un vehículo, para poder transportar su mercaderia.

Melania es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella tiene una bodega, la cual inicio con un pequeño capital. Ella, con la ayuda D. sus prestamos ha ido progresando en su negocio, llegando a tener una bodega cada vez mas surtida. Tiene como meta, hacer D. su negocio un minimarket, para lo cual se encuentra ahorrando.

Juana es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica a al venta D. jugos, negocio que inició al obtener su primer préstamo. Actualmente esta ahorrando para comprar animales para dedicarse a la venta D. su carne.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Niño Nativo" is located in the community of Acoria, which belongs to the department of Huancavelica. It is the oldest district of the province. María is married and has one son. She started her business by selling juice and drinks of all kinds. With the credits that she received, she increased her merchandise little by little, and now she has a small grocery store where she sells basic goods and offers a photocopying service since she was able to buy a copy machine. Now she is saving to buy a vehicle to be able to transport her merchandise. Melania is married and has three children. She has a grocery store, which she started with a small amount of capital. With the help of her loans, she has progressed her business and now has a grocery store that is becoming more and more well-supplied. She has a goal of having a mini-market, for which she is saving. Juana is married and has one son. She has a business selling juice, which she started when she received her first loan. Currently she is saving to buy animals so she can start selling meat.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal bank, "Niño Nativo" is requesting a loan so its 14 members can invest in their businesses

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N., 25 years-old, lives with her family in the province of Pursat in Cambodia. She and her husband are crop growers and the parents of two young children not yet in school. For over a year, the family has worked very hard at their business activities every day. During the morning and in the late afternoon they work their farmland using their older farming tools in order to have sufficient income to meet their family needs. Chan N. will use the loan to hire a cultivating machine for plowing farmland. The person shown in the picture above is Chan N.’s husband.

loans.use: To hire a cultivating machine for plowing farmland.

loans.name: Diomema

texts.en:
Diomema G. is 50 years old, married with 5 adult children and lives in Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She and her husband have a small fish pen that catches shrimp and other freshwater fishes, and a small oyster farm. She and her husband started this small business 29 years ago, and it has been the main source of income for their family. Her husband augments their family income by hiring out their family owned tricycle, a motorcycle with a sidecar attachment, to shuttle passengers around the town especially when demand for Oysters is low. At present their gross family income is around PHP12,800 or approximately $275/month. 

The fish pen and the oyster farm has sustained her family over the years. Now one of her daughters is a teacher in a private high school, which helps, but she needs the loan of PHP 17,000 or $375 to repair and expand their oyster beds and fish pen so that it could gain enough income to also support her adult son whom she has invited to help in the business.

This is Diomema's 11th consecutive loan with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation's Project Dungganon. She has been a member of good standing since 2004.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Anita

Anita M. is from the village of Camanga, Dumalinao. She is 57, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture raising livestock; her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 38 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann N. is a 27-year-old mother caring for one school-aged son. She and her husband work as farmers everyday planting various crops, especially rice crops, which they grow on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandmother. Chann N. hopes to grow rice after the heavy rains fall; thus, she has decided to seek a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers in the hopes of producing a good harvest at the end of this raiN. season. Note: Chann N.’s husband appears in the photo above at their farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nut

texts.en: Mr. Nut C., age 72, and is a modest father of three children, two are married and one is single. His wife stays at home to be responsible for housework. Nut C. is currently a cultivator, growing vegetables and fruit to earn a living. Another source of family income comes from his children who are working in different occupations; two are silk skirt sellers and one works in Phnom Penh. Nut C. saw that his children’s selling silk business is a profitable one for the family, so he decided to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a large quantity of silk skirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of silk skirts to sell.

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
From day to day, Oeu S. goes about buying essential ingredients, such as sugar, floor, banana and oil, that she uses to make grilled bananas. She works from her home and sells for a profit. Oeu S. is a humble 54-year-old villager. She is a mother blessed with seven children: five are single and two are married and living independently. Five of her children are employed in the field doing various work; while her husband works in construction.

Oeu S. will be using her loan to help sustain her daughter’s silk skirt business. That business is profitable and is helping to meet the family’s daily living expenses.

loans.use: To help sustain a silk skirt business

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en: Tieng R. currently retails pork that she buys in bulk, on credit, from her suppliers, who have their own pig farm and slaughtering operation. Tieng R. typically generates an income of $6 per day to meet her family’s daily living expenses. Tieng R. is 41 years old and a single mother. She was married but divorced her husband years ago and has no child. She lives with her older mother, who stays at home to be responsible for the daily housework. Since a national festival is coming, Tieng R. has many regular customers who need to order her pork for their cooking. To satisfy her customer's requirements, Tieng R. has decided to seek a loan for capital to accrue a larger quantity of pork to sell to those people.

loans.use: To accrue a larger quantity of pork to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Our featured entrepreneur is Michael H., 24, a young and active resident of Minsubong, Tangub City. Michael and his wife Merizel operate a mini-grocery in the city of Tangub. With an initial capital of P5,000.00 from their savings, they were able to sustain their business so far. The couple devote most of their their time to their business since they are still unblessed with a child. Michael joined PAGLAUM MPC in June 2009 because he was interested in our products and services. Now, he is applying for a loan of  P20,000.00 to add his capital for their mini-grocery. His future plan is to expand their business and be able to open another outlet in the city. He is also hoping that someday they will be blessed with an angel to complete the word “Family”.

loans.use: Additional capital for their Mini-Grocery Business

loans.name: Dimocrita

texts.en:
Mrs. Dimocrita G. is 59 years old, married with 6 adult children, and a resident of Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.

Dimocrita is a very good cook. Eight years ago she started a small restaurant and a variety store serving local dishes and selling native delicacies to both locals and tourists who visit the sea-side town of Hinigaran. Now with her children grown, Dimocrita wants to expand the small business that currently earns PHP 12,000.00 or about $250/month with the help of one of her daughters, so that it could also support her other children and their families.

With her daughter helping run the small restaurant and variety store, Dimocrita is now able supplement their family income, by working as the cook cum caretaker for one of the finest Beach Resorts in the area, but her real dream is to be able to expand her restaurant business.

The PHP19,500 loan she is borrowing will be used for additional working capital so that they could offer a wider variety of dishes and native delicacies to their growing number of loyal customers.

This is Dimocrita's 15th loan cycle with NWTF- Project Dungganon, and she has been a client of good standing since 2000.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: improvement/expansion of the borrower's business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo K. learned the skill of distilling white wine from her grandparents. In 2005, she used her skill to begin making wine to earn a living. She can make around 10 liters of wine a day which sells at 2,000 riels per liter. In addition, she uses the remaining rice after distilling wine to feed a few pigs to sell.

Mrs. Keo K. is married with one lovely young daughter who studies in primary school. She is looking for capital and requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used to buy additional rice for distilling wine.

loans.use: To buy additional rice for distilling wine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. of Old Pantalan, Brgy. 1, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental is 52 years old, married with a ninteen year old daughter. She joined NWTF in 2002 and is Member No. 03 of Group 654 of Center 67 of Project Dungganon - Hinigaran Branch.

Now at 52, she and her husband continue helping each other sell fishing at the local fishing port, while their 19-year old daughter minds their small variety store and cafeteria businesses that they started 7 years ago. Both business activities nets Teresita and her family PHP 7,000.00 or $150 per month.

She wants to borrow PHP 13,000.00 so that they can make improvements on the small cafeteria that she now runs with her young daughter, so that with the additional income she can better support her family and save enough to send her daughter to a good quality school for her college education.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is 51 years old, married with 3 adult children, and a resident of Sitio Tinago, Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 and is Member No. 05 of Group No. 351 of Center 56 in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.

Like many people in the seaside town of Hinigaran, Josephine and her husband have been growing oysters for sale and also maintain a small fishpen for the last 29 years. Since oyster and fish farming are very erratic sources of income, Josephine's husband earns a daily income by shuttling local passengers around town on his "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with a sidecar attached for passengers. Josephine and her husband earn an average of PHP 7,000.00 or about $187 per month from their oyster culture and fish pen business.

She is taking this PHP 18,000 loan to do repair and maintenance work on her small fish pen so that it could efficiently catch and trap the fish for a more bountiful harvest. This is Josephine's 13th loan cycle at NWTF- Project Dungganon, and she has always paid her loan on time and without any problems. The additional capital will help her and her family increase their income potential and make life a little more comfortable for Josephine and her husband especially now that they have reached midlife.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is 47 years old, single and a resident of Zone IV, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occiental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and is member No. 01 of Group 236, Center No. 37 of the Hinigaran Branch of NWTF-PD.

She started a General Store business 13 years ago to support herself and a niece. The General store is commonly known as a "sari-sari" store in the local dialect because it offers a wide variety of goods for sale from groceries to even hardware products. The variety store nets an average of PHP 6,500 or about $136 per month. Alma supplements her income by raising and fattening pigs which earns her an additional PHP 3,000 or $62.50/month.

She wants to use the PHP 17,000.00 loan to purchase more goods to resell in her Variety Store and for additional working capital. She is working hard and hopes to expand her business so that she can continue supporting and save enough for the education of her young niece.

She has previously paid up a loan of PHP 15,000.00 during her last loan cycle. This new loan is her 17th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita R., a 40-year old entrepreneur who lives with her three children (Jerlyn-17, Erica-16 and Mark-14) in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City, Philippines, has been a businesswoman for 10 years. She began with a sari-sari (variety) store, but cooking and selling breakfast goodies and snacks is what she most likes to do, so she has set-up a small “stand-up café” beside her store. She has her breakfast goodies and snacks in a small display case on top of a table.

Merlita and her husband parted ways years ago. Life was hard for her because she was left to take care of her three children, but thanks to her perseveR. and desire to move forward, she has achieved good results with her business. Her love for her children gives her the necessary strength to keep working for a better future. She now earns P25,000 per month from her business.

Merlita is now applying for a new loan of P15,000 from CCT Credit Cooperative, her eighth with the organization. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments and will be using the money to buy additional merchandise for her store. She also wants to expand her operation into a big convenience store so she won’t need to request loans in the future.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for the expansion of her store.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael R. is a 37 year old married man who lives with his wife, Ofelia, and their two children, aged 6 and 3, in a serene barrio (village) in Silang, Cavite. Ismael has been in the transportation business for five years and is an operator of a motorized tricycle. He earns P15,000 per month from his tricycle business. He also has a small variety store at home which his wife takes care of. Ismael joined Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. He religiously repaid his loan with the Cooperative on a weekly basis and has earned the trust and confidence of its staff and other members. He has applied for a new loan of P10,000 which he will use to obtain a government permit and franchise for another tricycle unit. He sees himself driving not just tricycles but, someday, a taxi or a jeepney (a small bus). About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.
