With the new profits from his expanded business, Kofi plans to further his children’s education.

loans.use: To repair his machine and also to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia B. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a mason.

Patricia sells salt at Eno near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Patricia uses her income to pay her family’s utility bills.

Patricia will use the loan to purchase more salt to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business and also to save the rest.

loans.use: To purchase more salt to sell

loans.name: Guillermina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Guillermina A., tiene la edad de 24 años, reside en el barrio La Primavera en la capital de Managua, casada y con hijo de 4 años, su esposo trabaja en zona franca. Ella laborara en una empresa Delipollos en la cocina. Tiene tres años de laborar, en su trabajo ella vende prendas de plata, oro laminado el cual es otro ingreso para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Sus planes es poder terminar su casa, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de prendas de plata para seguir ofertando a sus clientes, a si como la captación de clientes nuevos. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamo y poder desarrollarse, en su negocio, este es su cuarto ciclo y se ha beneficiado en crecimiento de inventario como en clientes.
texts.en:
The young Guillermina A., who is 24 years old, lives in the neighborhood of La Primavera, in the capital of Managua. She is married and has a 4-year-old son. Her husband works in the free port zone. She works in the kitchen of a business called "Delipollos." She has been working for three years. In her job, she sells silver and gold-plated items, which is another source of income to help improve her family's quality of life. Her goal is to be able to finish her house.

With this loan she wants to invest in buying silver accessories to continue selling to her customers and to get new customers as well. She is thankful to Afodenic for their support with loans that allow her to develop her business. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she has benefited from the increase in inventory and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy silver accessories

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 37 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, quien es mecánico, y el deseo de ambos es el progreso de su familia. Desde hace un año ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas y caballeros, mercadería que lleva a vender de casa en casa por los distintos lugares de su localidad, vendiendo al crédito o al contado, según acuerde con sus clientes. Para ella es muy importante tratar bien a sus clientes, pues de ello depende que le vuelvan a comprar, dice; además que le gusta conocer varios lugares de su ciudad, pues antes de trabajar no salía mucho de casa y hay lugares muy bonitos de su región que la dejan asombrada. Su negocio le viene dando buenas ganancias, pues también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la ayuda a vender según su disponibilidad de tiempo y así se generan más ingresos. Para un futuro, a Adela le gustaría tener una zapatería exclusiva para damas porque lo considera más rentable. Este es su 6to créditos con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es no tienen problemas y todos los integrantes son muy comunicativos y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más zapatos y de esa manera incrementará su stock.
texts.en:
Adela is 37 years old and lives with her husband who is a mechanic and the father of her three children. Their desire is the progress of their family. For a year she has been selling shoes for both women and men. She sells the merchandise by going house to house in different areas of her town. She sells on credit or for cash, according to what she agrees on with her customers. It is very important to her to treat her customers well because that determines if they will buy from her again. Additionally, she likes getting to know the different places in her city, since before she worked she didn’t go out of her house a lot and there are many beautiful places in her region that have amazed her. She has made good earnings with her business, and she also counts on the support of her husband, who helps her with sales when he is available, increasing her income. In the future Adela would like to have a shoe store exclusively for women because she considers this more profitable. This is her 6th loan with MFP and what she likes about her village bank is that they don’t have problems and all of the members are very communicative and responsible. With the money she is asking for she will buy more shoes and therefore increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es: Jeny tiene 28 años, es madre de un hijo de 10 años y vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en una maderera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos, productos de belleza, ropa y carteras, artículos que los exhibe en un pequeño mostrador en su casa. A Jeny le gusta mucho este negocio porque se mantiene ocupada, además le es rentable porque ya tiene clientes regulares que le hace pedidos constantemente y le pagan al contado, aunque también vende al crédito, pero son la minoría de sus clientes. Gracias a este trabajo y junto a las ganancias de su esposo están logrando solventar sus necesidades y los estudios de su pequeño hijo, quien en retribución al esfuerzo de sus padres, es un buen estudiante. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que son bien organizados y responsables. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio comprando mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Jeny is 28 years old and the mother of a 10-year-old son. She lives with her husband who works in a lumber yard. For four years she has sold shoes, beauty products, clothing and bags – all items that she displays on a small counter in her house. Jeny likes this business a lot because it keeps her busy. She also likes that it is profitable because she has regular customers who constantly make requests for items and pay in cash. She also sells on credit, but only a minority of her customers buys on credit. Thanks to this job and together with the earnings of her husband they are able to provide basic necessities and schooling for their small son, who, in payback for his parent’s effort, is a good student. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and what she likes best about working with her village bank is that they are well organized and responsible. She will invest her loan in her business by buying a larger variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente y con su hija de 14 años. Se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de varias líneas de belleza, estos productos son muy solicitados por las personas que viven por su zona, especialmente por las mujeres. Mercedes vende al crédito para cobrar semanal, quincenal o mensualmente, tal y como acuerda con cada uno de sus clientes. En este negocio de la venta de productos de belleza lleva ya 03 años y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aprender a tratar cada día mejor a sus clientes. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque dentro de la empresa donde trabaja pasó de vendedora a líder y está manejando grupos de personas que se dedican a la venta de estos productos. Para más adelante, Mercedes quiere tener una tienda de ropa y zapatos. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que han hecho un bonito equipo de trabajo, al cual está acostumbrada y son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina para mostrarlos y tenerlos protegidos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 47 years old, and lives with her husband who is a shop assistant and with her daughter who is 14 years old. She sells perfumes, cosmetics, and jewelry from various beauty lines. These products are in high demand by the people that live in her neighborhood, especially the women. Mercedes sells on credit for weekly, monthly, or bimonthly payments depending on the agreement she makes with each of her customers. She has been in her beauty product business for three years and what she likes best about her work is learning everyday how to treat her customers better. Additionally, her work is very profitable because within the business where she works she moved from saleswoman to leader and is managing groups of people who sell these products. For the future, Mercedes wants to have a clothing and shoe store. This is her 5th loan with MFP and what she likes best about her village bank is that they have made a beautiful work team that is well-accustomed and responsible. With the money she is asking for she will buy more beauty products and a display cabinet to show and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise and purchase of a display cabinet

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Nicolasa de 50 años de edad, mujer que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa, el cual inicio con ahorros y prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia. Con este crédito comprara ropa variada para damas y niños el cual atraerá clientes nuevos y lograra vender más. Sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder educar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 50 years old. Since she was young, she has sold clothing, and she started this business with savings and loans which AFODENIC has given her. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband works in security services, and they have a 17-year-old son who is a student.

With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothing for women and children, which will attract new customers, and she will be able to make more sales. Her plan is to improve the condition of her home and to educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es madre de un niño de 5 años que ya empezó a estudiar, vive con su esposo, quien es contador y trabaja en una institución privada. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, negocio que no le era muy productivo porque lo hacía en su casa y ésta no estaba ubicada en una zona comercial. Por ello decidió empezar a vender productos de belleza y ropa, negocio que también duro poco tiempo, porque Yeny decidió ejercer la profesión que había estudiado, que es de secretaria ejecutiva y es en lo que actualmente se desempeña desde hace un año. Gracias a sus remuneraciones mensuales, pudo ahorrar, y hace 6 mese emprendió el negocio de la compra y venta de madera trabajada (listones y tablas), el mismo que se encuentra a cargo su hermano, quien es el encargado de comprar la madera en las riberas, traerla a un aserradero para la corten y esté listas para la venta. Yeny se siente muy contenta, porque puede trabajar y tener un negocio propio al mismo tiempo, donde le está yendo bien. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, aunque algunas veces tiene discrepancias con algún compañero, pero se logran superar. Sin embargo, un factor importante en el progreso de su grupo, es que son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más madera para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeny has a five year old son who has already started school. She lives with her husband, an accountant who works for a private institution. She previously sold food. The business was not very productive because she did this at her house, which is not located in a commercial area. She decided to start selling beauty products and clothes. That also lasted a short time because Yeny decided to practice the profession that she had studied. She has now been an executive secretary for one year. Thanks to her monthly salary, she was able to save. Six months ago she started a business of buying and selling lumber (batten trim and paneling). Her brother is in charge of the business. He buys the wood by the waterside, takes it to the saw mill to be cut, and then it is ready to sell. Yeny feels very happy because she is able to work and to have her own business at the same time. It is going well for her. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She likes working with her community bank. At times there are differences between members, but they are able to overcome them. Nevertheless, an important factor in the group’s progress is that they are punctual with their payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy wood to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adina

texts.es: Adina tiene 32 años, es una emprendedora mujer que trabaja incansablemente en bienestar de su familia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes son su razón de vivir. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero no vende en un puesto o una tienda, sino que compra su mercadería y la ofrece casa por casa a sus amigas o vecinas, obteniendo así otros pedidos, los cuales ofrece a muy buen precio, puesto que hace llegar las prendas hasta el domicilio de quien las pidió, siendo muy solicitada por los clientes. Es por ello que Adina se siente feliz, ya que cada vez tiene más clientes, los cuales la buscan por su carisma y buen humor, su táctica de venta es mostrar las prendas y hacer que los posibles compradores se prueben la ropa, escogiendo las que le sean de su agrado, y ver cómo les queda, deciden comprar. Así, Adina también se siente contenta de ver felices a sus compradores con las prendas que les vendió. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda grande donde ofrezca toda su mercadería comprando vitrinas para su mejor exhibición. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, compartiendo todas las responsabilidades con sus amigas y compañeras de su grupo. Con el dinero solicitado espera comprar más ropa para ofrecerla durante este mes de fiestas patrias, donde las personas quieren estrenar ropa nueva, aprovechando esta oportunidad para generarse más ingresos.
texts.en:
Adina, 32, is an enterprising woman who works tirelessly for her family’s well being. She lives with her husband and her children, who are her reason for living. She sells clothes, but she does not sell in a stand or a store. Rather, she buys her merchandise and offers it door to door to her friends and neighbors. That way she gets other orders. She offers them at a very good price given that she delivers the clothes to the person’s house. She is sought after by her customers. She is happy about this, and she continues to gain customers. They look for her because of her charisma and good humor. Her selling tactic is to show the articles of clothing and have the possible buyers try on the clothing. She selects what they like, they see how it fits, and they decide to buy. Adina also feels happy to see her buyers happy with the clothes that she sells them. Her wish for the future is to have a large store where she can offer all of her merchandise and to buy showcases to better display her clothes. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual in all of her payments. She shares all of the responsibilities with her friends and colleagues in her group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more clothes to sell during this month of national holidays. During this time people want to wear new clothes, and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José Ramón tiene la edad de 44 años, reside en el barrio Villa Canadá en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, ella trabaja como domestica para poder salir a delante con su familia. y el trabaja en servicio de seguridad. Sus planes para su familia es  terminar de hacer su casa y poder dar estudio a sus hijos es por eso que ambos trabajan para salir adelante con su familia. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales de  construcción para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y hacerla de perlines para no mojarse como el año anterior. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos el cual ha sido de muchos beneficios para lograr los objetivos de mejorar cada día, su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ramón is 44 years old, and he lives in the Villa Canadá neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married, and he and his wife have three children who are studying. His wife works as a domestic worker to help their family get ahead, and he works in security services. Their plans for their family are to finish building their house, and for their children to continue studying. That is why they both work, to help their family move forward.

With this loan, he will invest in construction materials to change the roof of their house and build it with beams so it doesn't leak like it did last year. He gives his thanks to the Afodenic organization for their support with loans, which have helped him to achieve his goal of improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to change his roof

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora de 54 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, actividad que viene realizando por más de 8 años y negocio con el cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Ana está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite tener libertad a la hora de organizar sus tiempos, pues puede elaborar el desayuno y avanzar con el almuerzo para salir después a ofrecer su mercadería a todas sus vecinas y amigas de “Villa los Reyes”, como se llama la zona en la que vive. Su trabajo es muy cansado, pues requiere de caminar mucho y a veces cuando demoran en pagarle tienen que visitar a sus clientes casa por casa, pero Ana sigue adelante impulsada por las ganas de mejorar y brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia. Su deseo es tener una tienda en su domicilio para vender toda la mercadería necesaria para mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, es muy responsable cuando se trata de pagar, ya que sabe que sin responsabilidad no hay progreso. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para ofrecerlas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking woman. She is 54 years old, lives with her husband and children in her own house. She has been selling clothing house to house for more than 8 years. This business has allowed her to get her family off the ground. Ana is very content with her job, since it allows her to have freedom in when she does her work, since she can make breakfast and then lunch and then go out to sell her merchandise to all of her friends and neighbors in the “Villa los Reyes,” what the area where she lives is called. Her work is very tiring, since it requires her to walk a lot and sometimes when her customers delay their payments she has to visit them house by house. But Ana continues on, driven by the desire to improve and provide a better future for her family. Her desire is to have a store in her house to sell all the necessary merchandise to improve her income. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very responsible when it comes to paying, since she knows that without responsibility there is no progress. With the money she’s asking for she will buy a bigger quantity of clothing to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 33 años, es natural de la ciudad de Chiclayo (norte peruano), vive en su propia casa con su hijo Jahir de 10 años de edad. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de un postre típico de su departamento, llamado “King Kong”, el cual se prepara a base de harina, leche, capas de manjar blanco, dulce de membrillo o piña y maní, las presentaciones son de medio kilo o un kilo. Este producto lo prepara en su casa y lo vende según pedidos de sus clientes, hasta el momento le ha resultado muy rentable, ya que son muy ricos y solicitados. A Cecilia le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que la cocina siempre ha sido una de sus aficiones, aunque preparar grandes cantidades resulta cansado, pero ella ha sabido sobrellevar estos pequeños inconvenientes, pues trabaja por un fin en particular, el progreso de su pequeño hijo Jahir. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y Cecilia siempre ha sido muy puntual con su banco comunal llamado “Estrella Azul”, así que se siente muy bien trabajando con su grupo, el cual es muy unido y trabajador. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus dulces y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 33 years old and is a native of the city of Chiclayo (in Northern Peru), and lives in her own house with her 10 year old son Jahir. She is dedicated to making and selling a typical dessert from her area, called "King Kong," which is prepared with a base of flower, milk, white caramel, pineapple or quince sweet, and mani, the presentations of which are a half kilo or a kilo. She prepares this product in her house and she sells it to order to her clients. Until now, it has been very profitable, since they are very good and sought after. Cecilia likes her job a lo, since cooking has always been one of her hobbies, even though cooking large quantities results in her being tired, but she has learned to overcome the small inconveniences, so she works for a specific end, the progress of her young son Jahir. This is her fourth loan with MFP and Cecilia has always been on time with her community bank called Blue Star, since she feels very good working with her group which is very united and hardworking. With the requested money she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients for the preparation of her sweets and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyin ingredients to make her desserts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria una mujer muy estricta en cuando se refiere al trabajo, tiene 41 años y vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja y sus hijos: Jhon de 16, Ricardo de 11, Gisel de 7 y Emerson de 4 añitos de edad, los cuales le dan las fuerzas necesarias para seguir luchando por su porvenir. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, actividad que viene realizando hace más de 10 años, pero no sólo eso, ya que también tiene una tienda de abarrotes para acaparar la atención de la clientela, la cual es muy asidua a su negocio, pues pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan, ya que ella siempre está surtiendo y equipando muy bien su tienda. Adicionalmente, brinda el servicio de decoración para diversas celebraciones en casas o locales. Macaria le tiene mucha fe a su trabajo, ya que sabe que todo es cuestión de creatividad para echar a andar un nuevo negocio y lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia, ella en el futuro quiere poner una peluquería y no descansará hasta ver este sueño realidad. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella acostumbra solicitar préstamos individualmente, pero también pertenece a un grupo.Con este dinero comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Macaria is very strict when it comes to her work. She is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their four children: Jhon – 16, Ricardo - 11, Gisela - 7, and Emerson – 4. Her children give her the strength to continue fighting for the future. She sells beer from her home, which she has done for over 10 years. In addition, she also operates a grocery store in order to grab her customers’ attention. It is a very steady business where everyone can find what they need. She is always expanding her inventory and keeps her store well stocked. Macaria also offers a decoration service for different celebrations held at the customer’s home or at other locations. She puts much faith into her work, because it takes creativity to start a new business. Her earnings are necessary to preserve her family’s well-being. In the future, she would also like to open a hair salon and will not rest until this dream is a reality.

This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She normally takes out individual loans, but she also belongs to a communal bank group. With this money, she will buy a larger quantity of beer and other products to restock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Urruz Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Arroz tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, casado y su esposa le tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejora  a su casa, el trabaja como técnico en las maquinas de tragamonedas. Con este crédito es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias ya que podrá invertir en materiales de construcción para anexar un cuarto y poder tener mejor privacidad como comodidad para su familia. También espera tener salud y trabajo para poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien el cual será una sastifaccion de padre.
texts.en:
Urruz is 39, and he lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married, and they have two minor children. Their plan is to be able to finish making improvements to their house. He works as a technician on slot machines. This loan is his second loan cycle with Afodenic. He is grateful that he will be able to buy construction materials to add a room and have the comfort of better privacy for his family. He hopes to have good health and work to be able to help his children so that they can have an education. This would be a father’s satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to add a room

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their town.

Faustina is a trader and trades in secondhand bedspreads. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community markets. She buys the secondhand bedspreads from the city’s secondhand clothing market and retails to her customers in villages and small towns.

Faustina has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more bales of used bedspreads, and to add the sale of secondhand clothes to expand her business. She desires to give her children a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used bedspreads and to add the sale of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is twenty-five years old and married. She is the mother of one child, a daughter, who is currently in pre-school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in their community.

Eunice sells assorted biscuits (cookies). She sells her biscuits on a table at the community's public school and in the market square. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy more biscuits. She desires to expand her business and add the sales of other groceries. This, she believes, will help her save more and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 47 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are currently in school, one just completed junior high and is waiting to enter senior high school, and the other two are quite independent.

To support her household, Ama has been hawking cosmetics (going door-to-door) in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. Aside from her hawking business she also supplies home appliances like blenders, rice cookers and cooking utensils on credit to workers.

Ama says the selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income for her family’s needs. Her dream is to be able to see her kids through education to the tertiary level as her legacy for her kids to aid them in their future lives.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Malahka Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed S., Yeabu K. , Isatu K. and Aruna I. K.. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town. They are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to help them develop their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make better profit, and consequently improve on their standards of living.

Mohamed S. (right) is the leader of the group. Mohamed is twenty-five years of age. He was born in Makeni but now lives and sells in Magburaka together with his wife and two children. One of Mohamed's children is in class four and the other is in class one. Mohamed sells watches, phone accessories, radios and a lot more. He has been a businessman for five years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is 30 years old and is married with two children who are currently in school. Kofi sells used jeans and khaki trousers on a pavement in Kasoa. He says the selling of jeans and khaki trousers and knickers, especially for men, is very profitable and therefore he has been selling for the past ten years to support himself and his family.

With the loan, Kofi wants to buy bales of jeans and khaki trousers and knickers to increase his inventory and sales for a good income. He believes this loan will help him save more money to rent a stall at which to sell his goods, since pavements are not reliable stations for selling. He would be grateful to attract your support.

loans.use: To buy bales of jeans and khaki trousers and knickers

loans.name: Chanta Arame

texts.fr: Chantal, 50 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Son activité est la vente de boisson et la restauration. Elle veut un prêt pour réparer son congélateur, acheter des stocks pour vendre de la boisson et le petit déjeuner. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Chantal, age 50, is married and has 7 children to support. Her business consists in selling drinks and foods. She wants a loan to repair her freezer, replenish her stock to sell drinks and breakfasts. Her income enables her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her freezer and replenish her stock of food and drinks

loans.name: Sanda Association Group

texts.en:
This is Abu K., Abu B., Harrison J. K., Adamsay S. and Sheika T.. They are motorbike riders in the town of Magburaka except for Adamsay S. who is a businesswoman. They call their group Sanda Association, named after their village. This will be the fourth loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they have experienced a vast improvement in their lives, as their income levels have increased.

Abu K. (right) is the leader of the group. He was born in the town of Magburaka twenty-four years ago. He is married with one child who is still not of school-going age. Abu is an Okada (motor bike) rider. He transports people within Magburaka and surrounding villages and has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice K. is 37 years old and is married to a man named Josphat. They are blessed with two children. Her business is located at Mafuta Centre in Eldoret Town. Eunice has been growing corn for the past six years. She was introduced to KADET by a client who is also a KADET borrower. Eunice intends to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her corn crop. In future, she hopes to diversify to other crops and someday be able to buy a tractor. She wants to increase her profit and be better able to provide a good education for her children and be able to build a permanent house for her family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn crop

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce K. is a 52-year-old widow with four children. She lives in Mikindani, Mombasa where she owns rental houses. She has been a landlady for two years. She is also a trained counselor and offers her services to residents of Mikindani. This will be Joyce's first loan from KADET. With the money from the loan, she plans refurbish her rental houses and purchase a water pump in order to improve the living conditions and water supply of her tenants. In future she hopes to build better and more decent rental houses for her clients through subsequent loans from KADET. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To refurbish her rental houses and to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Xiomara García, tiene una pulpería que desde hace seis años logro poner con ahorros y préstamos que Afodenic a otorgado. Tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos uno trabaja y dos estudian, madre soltera y con mucho deseo de salir adelante con su familia. con este crédito comprar mercadería variada como: granos básicos,  golosinas, carnes,  entre otros el cual aumentara su inventario y ventas. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados. Sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su pulpería.
texts.en:
Sra. Xiomara García opened a grocery store six years ago using her savings and a loan she received from AFODENIC. She is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital of Managua. Sra. Xiomara has three children, of whom one is working while the other two are students. She is a single mother and would very much like for her family to get ahead.

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of merchandise such as basic grains, candy, meat, and other products to increase her inventory and her sales. She thanks the institution for helping her succeed. Her plans include improving the infrastructure of her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, meat, and other products

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a 30-year-old woman, married with three children. Currently all her three children are in school.

Agatha enjoys selling and has much experience in customer care. She has been selling maize and powdered pepper for four years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

Agatha wants to use the loan to buy maize and powdered pepper in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy maize and powdered pepper in bulk

loans.name: Kalamera Group

texts.en:
This is Abibatu C., Mariatu K. and Mohamed S.. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Kalamera. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve on their standards living.

Abibatu C. (left) is the leader of the group. She was born in Magburaka and is now thirty-five years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. One of their children is now in Junior Secondary School I, another is in class III and one is still not of school-going age. Abibatu sells market food and has been in this business for ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with a child. She is a 30-year-old trader. She trades in fabrics, Dumas clothes, women's slippers, etc. Lydia says her working capital was provided by her husband; unfortunately, it was not adequate for her business and does not enable her to purchase a high quantity of quality products. 

She believes that with the loan, she will be more resourced to purchase quality stock for her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of Dumas clothes, laces, women's slippers and fabrics to make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of Dumas clothes and fabrics

loans.name: Eunice  Nyambura

texts.en:
Eunice Nyambura is 26 years old, married and blessed with one child. She owns a beauty salon in Gitaru, Kikuyu.

Eunice has been running the business for a period of six years with a monthly profit of about 27,500 Kenyan shillings (about $350). With the proceeds from this loan, she plans to restock her salon with beauty products of different varieties. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a member.

Eunice's clients are mainly children and ladies.  She hopes to own a bigger salon someday, and open a hair-styling and beauty-training college.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to resell at a salon

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. All four of her children are currently in school. She sells corn and cassava dough in the community market. Corn dough is milled maize grain mixed with water and used to prepare local meals like banku, kenkey and porridge. Cassava dough is also milled cassava mixed with water. Cassava dough is mostly added to corn dough to prepare banku. 

She hopes to raise income to support her husband with providing a better education for her children. She wants to use the loan to buy more cassava and corn dough to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cassava and corn dough in bulk

loans.name: Damarys Johanna

texts.es: La señora Damaris P., madre soltera de tres hijos de 10,11 y 16 años de edad, tiene 33 años, reside  en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa y dar estudios a sus tres hijos. Ella trabaja en servicio domestico un trabajo agotador pero tiene que trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia. Con este crédito comprar materiales de construcción para levantar su casa la mitad de piedra y el resto de madera, para poder vivir con su hijo en mejores condiciones ya que su casa es de lamina de zinc ya muy viejas y tiene mucho zarro es por eso le urge hacer las mejoras. Ya que se hace difícil solo ella trabajar. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios de las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris P. is the single mother of three children ages 10, 11, and 16. She is 33, and she lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital of Managua. Her plans are to be able to finish making her house and to give an education to her three children. She works in domestic services. It is exhausting work, but she has to work to be able to help her family. With this loan she will buy construction materials to raise her house, which is half stone and the rest wood. She will do this to be able to live in better conditions with her children. Her house is made of very old zinc sheeting, and it is very rusty. That is why she wants to make the improvements now. It is difficult for her to be the only one working. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits of improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on her house

loans.name: Kathegbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Umu J., Mummy C. and Umaru K.. They call their group Kathegbeh. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of Le 500,000 for each to help them develop their businesses. With the help of this loan, their businesses will increase both in size and quality, attracting more customers so that sales will improve, profit will also increase and consequently, their standards of living will improve.

Umu J. (left) is the leader of this group. She is 30 years of age and married to a businessman. They have five children. Two of her children are attending schools and the rest are still not of school-going age. Umu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and rice. She has been a businesswoman for three years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is 34 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. Roselyn is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her residence and sells it at the lorry station in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the central market of the city. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk to expand her business. It is Roselyn’s desire to give all her children quality education and provide them with a quality life.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old mother of five operating her food kiosk business in the Mukuru slum of Nairobi, where she lives. She is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to expand her business. She hopes that one day she will own a big restaurant and provide catering services, so as to educate her children to the highest level possible. She describes herself as faithful and friendly.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To expand a food business

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Denise T. est une femme mariée de 44 ans qui s’active dans la plantation  et le commerce de bananes. Elle vend aussi des légumes. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’entretenir sa plantation de bananes et d’acheter des légumes à revendre. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Denise T., age 44, is married and her business consists in growing and selling bananas. She also sells vegetables. The loan she's seeking will enable her to look after her banana plantation and to buy vegetables for resale. Her goal is to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To look after her banana plantation and to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Genodi Group

texts.en:
Monica is 42 years old. She is a divorced mother of two boys who are currently in school. She is a resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business. She is a petty trader and sells at the community market square; she enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, etc. on top of a table in the market. She takes stock of goods from the Kumasi central market (which is a nearby city) and her surrounding communities for the vegetables. She is requesting a loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Genodi’ which literary means believe in Him (God). She is the one in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy items in order to upgrade her inventory

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 37-year-old trader. He is married with three children. He has sold used clothes like shirts for men in the local market for 12 years. His major business challenge over the years has been obtaining funds to scale up the business. He has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used shirts and add the sale of used trousers to serve his customers. He hopes to save enough to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy bales of used shirts

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 31-year-old father of one. He operates his boda boda (motorbike taxi) business in Massai Village in Nairobi Kenya, where he lives. Having first worked as a casual labourer, Richard hired a motorbike, which he is currently running. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to buy his own second-hand motor bike. He hopes to own fuel pumps and vehicles one day, as well as his own home. He wishes to educate his children and raise a stable family. He describes himself as energetic, with a good personality, high self-esteem and a good character.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Psalm 23 Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 50 years old. She is a married mother of three children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She and her husband and children live together. She works hard to provide food and school fees for the children. She is a qualified teA. and this has given her the opportunity to understand the importance of education. She is providing all educational support to the children. In spite of the challenges she faces, she has been a baker for 12 years. Using flour for her production, she prepares bread and sells it to her customers. She supplies bread by herself in the market center to her customers. And people also come to her to buy. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business.           

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Psalm 23’. She is the one in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia M. E.  tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace un año, local lo tiene en su misma casa; con un cuarto que fue construyendo con ahorros propios ya que antes solo trabajaba su esposo pero ahora con su negocio quiere aportar a los gastos familiares. La señora Leticia quiere comprar mercancía nueva para que el cliente se vaya satisfecho y no vaya a buscar a otro lugar ya que las tiendas están muy retiradas.
texts.en:
Leticia M. E. has been selling groceries for one year. Using her savings, she added a room to her house to create space for her store. Her husband was previously the sole breadwinner, but she wanted to start this business so that she could contribute toward the family expenses.

Sra. Leticia plans to buy new merchandise because she wants to satisfy her customers since they are not willing to go elsewhere because other stores are too far to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a secondhand taxi

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía H. M. se dedica a la venta de gorditas desde hace un año el lugar donde instaló  el negocio necesita varios arreglos ella quiere ponerle vitropiso y un pintada para que este presentable. Las gorditas las hace de varios guisos y son de maíz y las vende a un precio accesible para el cliente, Desde un principio la gente iba a comprar pensando que vendía pollos por que la por fuera esta pintado con un pollo ya que antes de ella instalarse se vendían pollos asados. Ella quiere cambiar la fachada para que la gente que en ese lugar se vende Gorditas.
texts.en:
Sofia H. M. has been selling gorditas for one year. Her place of business needs a few improvements -- she wants to install a ceramic tile floor and add a coat of paint to make it presentable. Her gorditas are made with corn and served with different stews. She sells her dishes at a price that any customer can afford.

From the beginning, people thought she sold poultry dishes because a picture of a chicken is painted on the outside of her business and the previous establishment sold roasted chickens. She wants to change the facade of her business so that people know that she sells gorditas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make physical improvements to her business (paint & a tile floor)

loans.name: Liberty Group

texts.en:
Regina is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two girls and one boy and all are currently in school. For five years, she has been a baker and uses flour for her production. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cake, meat pie, plantain chips, etc., and sells them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery from her. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Liberty’. She is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred owns a butchery in the Lunga Lunga part of the Mukuru slum in Nairobi. Alfred has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to expand his business, which he has successfully run for the last 10 years. He hopes to one day open multiple locations for his butchery.  Married with one child, Alfred also cares for his parents. On a personal level, he hopes to one day move his family and see his children get a good education.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is twenty-six  years old and a businessman. He is married and has one child, who is currently in school. William trades in jeans clothing for men, like pants, shorts, etc. He buys his jeans clothing at wholesale prices and sells at retail to his customers. William wants to use the loan to include the sale of ladies' jeans clothing so he can meet the demands of both men and women.  He hopes to use part of his profit to support his child in school and also to get his own store. William believes in his ability to achieve the full potential of his business once he increases his working capital by receiving the loan.

loans.use: To buy ladies jeans in bulk

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is thirty-five years old and a widow with eight children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Hawa is a trader. She deals in clothing materials. She sells at the market square and also hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. Hawa has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy more textiles to increase her stock. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To increase her stock of textiles

loans.name: Ebeyeyie Group

texts.en:
Michael is thirty-six years old and married with four children (all boys), all of whom are currently in school. He is a hard-working young man who provides for his family. Michael started his business six years ago, selling soft drinks of all kinds. Through his work he is well known by many who have purchased from his rented shop. Usually he gets his inventory from companies like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and the like. He wants a loan to buy a larger assortment of soft drinks to upgrade his inventory.

Because of his commitment and availability Michael was chosen as the group leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ebeyeyie’ which literally means "it shall be well". He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. The other members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and thus experience peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of soft drinks.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 70 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all out of school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She deals in bags of salt. Georgina sells at the market square and hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. She has been in business for 30 years and wants a loan to buy bags of salt in bulk to increase her stock. She aspires to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt

loans.name: Georgette Ngoné

texts.fr: Georgette Ngoné T., 53 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans l’élevage, la vente de bœuf, la vente de légumes et la restauration. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Georgette Ngoné T., age 53, is married and has 9 children to support. Her business consists in raising and selling cattle, selling vegetables, and food serving. Her income enables her help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise and sell cattle, sell vegetables, and serve food

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader. Agnes is into cosmetic sales. She sells at the market square and hawks to sell in her community. She treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well. Agnes has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy more cosmetic goods to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Clap For Jesus Group

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old.  He is married and the father of two children. Both of his children are in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, etc. in his neighborhood. He lives with his wife and his dear children. He said all that he is working hard to achieve is because of his children's future. For that reason, he does not relax when it comes to business. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve his savings to support his children in school. He believes that with his four years experience he will be able to make good use of the loan.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Clap for Jesus’. He is the one in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery products
